results.description:
We gather to meditate, share our stories, and engage in practices that expand our moral imagination, get real about the social and ecological crisis our world is in, and renew our sense of hope and purpose in regards to the Great Turning towards a life-sustaining society.

The people in our group share a common journey of waking up to our interconnection with life around us. We are discovering what it means to be a part of Earth and to choose to be part of the process of Earth's self-healing.  In our meetings we engage in processes and practices from the Work That Reconnects, a type of group work or spiritual practice for activists who are seeking Earth's healing and justice for Earth's peoples. 

Please join us.  No prior experience with the Work That Reconnects is required, though if you do have experience that is great.  Periodically there are 1-day experiential trainings in the Boston area we can connect you with.

Our Work That Reconnects Praxis Group meets once a month on a weekday evening from 7-9pm.  Newcomers are always welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the sanctuary lobby of the Common Street Spiritual Center--come right in the front door and you'll find us.
results.name: Experience the Work That Reconnects (Earth Activist Spirituality)

This event is open to all members of Unity Games, Metrowest Gamers, MENSA, Meetup, and others. results.description:
Thursday, February 11, 2016  | 7:30 pm - 8:30 pm


We live in a constantly changing and an unpredictable world yet we all crave and reach for certainty. But the only thing that's certain, is that nothing is certain.Uncertainty is a fact of life and possibly where the greatest opportunities are. So whether you're someone who enjoys uncertainty or gets anxious about it - you may as well relax, and learn to thrive in uncertainty.
If you want to thrive in uncertainty, join us to explore how to:

• Overcome the anxiety of uncertainty and stop struggling with it

• Embrace uncertainty and find joy in it

• Think on your feet and improvise in the face of uncertainty

• Navigate through it more comfortably and confidently
results.name: How to survive in Uncertainty

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Lichtenauer Longsword

results.description:
Tim Hall is an educator, artist, and entrepreneur, from Detroit, MI. He began playing music at the age of 10, and found poetry in college as a way to share his thoughts on paper. After college Tim joined a poetry collective called Wisdom Beyond Words where he crafted his bold stage presence and vibrant imagery. Tim Hall draws inspiration from his lived experiences, charting the nuances of blackness, masculinity, and the beauties of life. He has performed in spaces all around the Midwest and Greater Boston areas, and has opened for artists such as Neiel Israel, Regie Gibson, the Asia Project of BET’s Def Poetry Jam, and soul singer Lalah Hathaway. Tim Hall has a Masters in Education and currently serves as a resident director at Berklee College of Music using his skills to create programming, workshops, and curriculum as a way to help others on their journey to living a fulfilling life. He is thankful for every opportunity to share his art and connect with others.


FB – www.facebook.com/1SoulP


TW & Insta– tv_hall

*****

results.description:
February is here, and what better way to kick it off than with some fantastic sketch comedy?!

First up, it's Terrible People: Made up of the most aggro sketch comedians in Boston, Terrible People will make you hate yourself for laughing and call your pastor after to apologize. Come get drunk and be one of the Terrible People.

Then, your headliner: CONVERSATIONS WITH BODY LANGUAGE is wordless solo sketch comedy. A loving update to Charlie Chaplin and Buster Keaton, Mike Spara's solo project combines silent film sensibility, modern music and absurdity into a mix-tape for your imagination. A New Orleans-based writer, improviser and sketch comedian, he is also a co-founder of The New Movement New Orleans. Mike has performed throughout the country with The New Movement, sketch group Stupid Time Machine, and now Conversations with Body Language, including multiple years at New Orleans Fringe, SoundOff Fest, SF Sketch Fest, and more.

"Mike Spara is a mad genius," - Philly Improv Theater.
"Conversations with Body Language is amazing," - Arcade Comedy Theater.
"This changes everything," - Black Friday Comedy Marathon.

PLUS: Host Jordan Handren-Seavey and special guest star Matt Miller, not to mention the return of of YOUR sketch comedy open mic, Openhaus! It's a jam-packed spectacular of amazing proportions - don't miss it!
results.name: Hilarious & Innovative Sketch Comedy You Need to See to Believe!

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $20 (members) or $30 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html


PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

results.description:
"WebPromo SEO Day – Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo"

To Register for this event you must click on this link

WHEN: February 12, 2016 @3:30 pm - 5:30 pm EUROPE/LONDON

ORGANIZER: WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke 

CO-HOSTS:  Moz - Rand Fishkin 

                     SEMrush - Michael Stricker

                     Similarweb - Boaz Sasson

                      BuzzSumo  - Steve Rayson 


This year we have International institutional SEO giants:  Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo and the brilliant speakers: Rand Fishkin, Boaz Sasson, Michael Stricker and Steve Rayson.

In 2015, BuzzSumo became tool of a choice for the majority of marketers. We have done little survey asking respondents to name the 5 SEO tools they regularly use, BuzzSummo was included almost every time. 

Absolutely everyone in our survey picked Similarweb, an extremely popular tool, but very few people know how much different the Free and Paid versions are, and the paid version has plenty of options itself from “cheap” to very expensive. 2016 brings a lot of updates and new options for Similarweb. 

SEMrush has been on the market, seems forever, but the company managed to keep the tool fresh and up to date. It is very popular among our respondents. Michael Stricker, U.S. Director of Marketing for SEMrush, has exclusive new data (prepared for this Conference) regarding how Google is treating the new TLDs (Top Level Domain). Be among the first to see this...

Moz Open Site Explorer is a popular tool. Rand Fishkin seems to be in a league of his own. We will be happy to put your questions to Rand, register to the conference and use reply button of the “Welcome email” to send us your questions.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Why attend this webinar:

1. You can ask Rand Fishkin a question Live!

2. Listen and ask question to Similarweb and SEMrush

3. Listen to Steve "BuzzSumo" Rayson

More information about the speakers:

WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke - marketing manager - Twitter @WebPromoExperts

Moz - Rand Fishkin - Wizard of Moz - Twitter @randfish

Some people don't need an introduction...

SEMrush - Michael Stricker - U.S. Marketing Director - Twitter @RadioMS

U.S. Marketing Director at SEMrush: April 2014 – Present. Connecting search marketing competitive research with a community of digital marketing experts in SEO, PPC, Content Marketing, Data Research, E-Commerce, Social Media. Enabling consultants, agencies and brands to discover and control the web's most versatile, innovative suite of data tools to perfect their digital marketing campaigns. Helping to promote new market-matching capabilities via agile marketing.

Similarweb - Boaz Sasson - performance marketing specialist - Twitter @SimilarWeb

Currently working as the performance marketing specialist for SimilarWeb.com and Developer.SimilarWeb.com, scope includes SEO, paid search, GDN, Facebook, as well as work on the actual funnels (optimizing and testing ads, landing pages, messages and offers). Started at SimilarWeb in 2009 as a part-time SEO consultant, when we were still called SimilarGroup. Main focus was on SimilarSites.com. Took the site from 7 thousand unique visitors a day to 10-12 million monthly visitors.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Mobile ready Recording available,  Slides/PDF available


Added Instructions - How To Register: 

Webinara helps you find webinars for different areas of interest, and notify you when there is a new webinar, within your own areas of interest. 

All webinars provided by Webinara are hosted by companies from around the world using different webinar platforms to provide you the webinar. 

When you click Register for the webinar, you need to be logged in to Webinara to come to registration page. 

If the webinar has 1-click registration, and you are logged in to Webinara, you can click the 1-click registration and you will automatically be registered for the webinar. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar.

If the webinar registration button says Register, you need to be logged into Webinara, and when clicking the Registration button, you will be redirected to the webinar registration page for webinar organizer. Register there to get webinar confirmation email. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar

You can login to Webinara or register to Webinara using your email, or just click Sign in with Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

Take the information below with you because it can be a little tricky to get to the first time you go.  Please allow a little extra time to follow signs.

Once you are on Endicott St, go to the very end and turn left. The Antique shops will be on your right and the pond will be on your left. Take a right after the antique shops and follow the signs directing you to Turn Around Training. Follow the road in the parking lot to the end. 

They are located in the very back of all the buildings in the rear of building.  You will see a sign on a gate saying Turn Around Training. The door is just to the right of that. Walk right in! Will give you my cell phone number in case of any problems.

You will see (and hear) a yard of big dogs; that is not where we are.  Park right after that and go in the door on the right that is Turn Around Training.


Please update your RSVP if your plans change, but we hope to see everyone there! We are so lucky to get this space as it is a very, very large room. So bring all your friends who have small dogs!


Take my cell phone number [masked]) with you and call or text if you cannot find the place.  Don't give up and go back home! It is a little tricky to find the first time you go there as you have to go around to the back of the buildings.
results.name: Let's Have Some Valentine February Fun!

results.description:
All Are Invited: Lunchtime Meet Up at Rebecca's Café!
 SPC members have long expressed an interest in an additional channel for unstructured networking and just plain schmoozing about their business triumphs and trials.
Here's how it works: You just show up! No need to pay a fee.
Rick Pollack of Presentation Medic, a member of the SPC Board, has volunteered to anchor this gathering. This meeting is a bring your own agenda, or just enjoy lunch with other consultants.
Find yourself something appealing to nosh on, settle at the cash register, and join the group. We've picked 1 p.m. on a Friday as our start time to avoid the crush and let people take as much time as they feel they can afford...and maybe start a new conversation they can pick up later!
Mark your calendar now ... you don't even have to sign up on our website!

results.description:
All;

We have a pretty unique opportunity to do pop-up coworking at Aeronaut Brewery.  The fine folks at Aeronaut are making their space available for the Workbar Pop-up coworking event, and Workbar has invited us to join them for the session.

I will be there from 3 to 5pm, and look forward to meeting as many of you (we have a 15 person limit) that can make it. We do need to get an accurate headcount, so please RSVP only if you can really make it.

Workbar's Invitation: "Feeling cooped up working from home all alone? Love local beer? We've got a great way for you to ease into your weekend with Workbar (and a few drinks). 

We're hosting an exclusive pop-up coworking session at Aeronaut Brewery from 3-6pm next Friday, 2/12. They'll be opening up the bar early just for us, with founder Ben Holmes working the taps. We'll have awesome people, free Wifi"

Not sure what coworking is? Well it's simply an opportunity to work along side other professionals without necessarily working on the same project.

On-street parking is available (2 hour limit).
results.name: Pop Up Coworking Hosted by Workbar and Aeronaut Brewery

results.description:
Tyrants, Violence, and the Rules that Run the World  - a book talk & signing … 

… with author Leif Wenar, political philosopher and Chair of Philosophy and Law at King's College London

Event link HERE. This event is free; no tickets are required. 

This is the inaugural event in the Harvard University Edmond J. Safra Center for Ethics speaker series "Ethics in Your World", featuring leading thinkers taking on tough problems that matter to us all.


Friday, February 12th, 3pm

Harvard Book Store - 1256 Mass. Ave.

:: :: ::

Professor Wenar holds the Chair of Philosophy and Law at King's College London. He earned his degrees in Philosophy from Stanford and from Harvard, where he worked with John Rawls and with Robert Nozick. He has been a Visiting Professor at Princeton and at Stanford, and has been a Fellow of the Carnegie Council Program in Justice and the World Economy. 

The book will be for sale at the event for 20% off.
results.name: Ethics (part 1)

results.description:
"WebPromo SEO Day – Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo"

To Register for this event you must click on this link

WHEN: February 12, 2016 @3:30 pm - 5:30 pm EUROPE/LONDON

ORGANIZER: WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke 

CO-HOSTS:  Moz - Rand Fishkin 

                     SEMrush - Michael Stricker

                     Similarweb - Boaz Sasson

                      BuzzSumo  - Steve Rayson       


This year we have International institutional SEO giants:  Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo and the brilliant speakers: Rand Fishkin, Boaz Sasson, Michael Stricker and Steve Rayson.

In 2015, BuzzSumo became tool of a choice for the majority of marketers. We have done little survey asking respondents to name the 5 SEO tools they regularly use, BuzzSummo was included almost every time. 

Absolutely everyone in our survey picked Similarweb, an extremely popular tool, but very few people know how much different the Free and Paid versions are, and the paid version has plenty of options itself from “cheap” to very expensive. 2016 brings a lot of updates and new options for Similarweb. 

SEMrush has been on the market, seems forever, but the company managed to keep the tool fresh and up to date. It is very popular among our respondents. Michael Stricker, U.S. Director of Marketing for SEMrush, has exclusive new data (prepared for this Conference) regarding how Google is treating the new TLDs (Top Level Domain). Be among the first to see this...

Moz Open Site Explorer is a popular tool. Rand Fishkin seems to be in a league of his own. We will be happy to put your questions to Rand, register to the conference and use reply button of the “Welcome email” to send us your questions.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Why attend this webinar:

1. You can ask Rand Fishkin a question Live!

2. Listen and ask question to Similarweb and SEMrush

3. Listen to Steve "BuzzSumo" Rayson

More information about the speakers:

WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke - marketing manager - Twitter @WebPromoExperts

Moz - Rand Fishkin - Wizard of Moz - Twitter @randfish

Some people don't need an introduction...

SEMrush - Michael Stricker - U.S. Marketing Director - Twitter @RadioMS

U.S. Marketing Director at SEMrush: April 2014 – Present. Connecting search marketing competitive research with a community of digital marketing experts in SEO, PPC, Content Marketing, Data Research, E-Commerce, Social Media. Enabling consultants, agencies and brands to discover and control the web's most versatile, innovative suite of data tools to perfect their digital by TermCoach">MARKETING CAMPAIGNS. Helping to promote new market-matching capabilities via agile marketing.

Similarweb - Boaz Sasson - performance marketing specialist - Twitter @SimilarWeb

Currently working as the performance marketing specialist for SimilarWeb.com and Developer.SimilarWeb.com, scope includes SEO, paid search, GDN, Facebook, as well as work on the actual funnels (optimizing and testing ads, landing pages, messages and offers). Started at SimilarWeb in 2009 as a part-time SEO consultant, when we were still called SimilarGroup. Main focus was on SimilarSites.com. Took the site from 7 thousand unique visitors a day to 10-12 million monthly visitors.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Mobile ready Recording available,  Slides/PDF available

Added Instructions - How To Register: 

Webinara helps you find webinars for different areas of interest, and notify you when there is a new webinar, within your own areas of interest. 

All webinars provided by Webinara are hosted by companies from around the world using different webinar platforms to provide you the webinar. 

When you click Register for the webinar, you need to be logged in to Webinara to come to registration page. 

If the webinar has 1-click registration, and you are logged in to Webinara, you can click the 1-click registration and you will automatically be registered for the webinar. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar.

If the webinar registration button says Register, you need to be logged into Webinara, and when clicking the Registration button, you will be redirected to the webinar registration page for webinar organizer. Register there to get webinar confirmation email. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar

You can login to Webinara or register to Webinara using your email, or just click Sign in with Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn.

results.description:
Join other sex positive people of all genders and sexual orientations from all over New England and beyond to attend  New England's largest BDSM education event.

An RSVP on Meetup will not register you or hold a space for you. Detailed info is available via the text and producer's website linked below..

About this event

The Fetish Fair Fleamarket is the largest event for the BDSM community in New England bringing thousands of participants together with vendors from all over the U.S. and Canada as well as introductory classes from local, national and international presenters.

This event is convention style, a la carte, allowing you to attend the parts that interest you.

People of all genders and sexual orientations are welcome.

About the Sponsor

The New England Leather Alliance (NELA) is an organization dedicated to making a safe place in the world for all leather/fetish/sm people through education, advocacy, and charitable giving.  Find out more at the NELA website www.nelaonline.org

Practical Details

You can get more information about this event including Admission fees and policies, program schedule, location and vendor information at the Register Here link below.

Registration & Policies

==> Register here<a href="https://nelaonline.org/fetish-fair-fleamarket/winter-fleamarket"></a>

Tickets, admission policies including ID Requirements and other information can be found at the above link.

Make sure to mark your calendar now.

Got Questions?

The best place to get your questions answered is via the Sponsor's website links posted above.

Comment below to connect with others who may be going.

results.description:
It's been a while since we meditated together so I though it is about time to change that! Let's meet to practice Loving Kindness Meditation.


Loving Kindness Meditation is a great method for developing compassion and cultivating positive emotions. There will be a 20 min guided meditation practice followed by a discussion. We will also explore ways of increasing kindness, love and connection in our lives. Right in time for Valentine's Day! 

In a few days, it will also be 7 years since I started this meetup! Yet another reason to meet and mark this important milestone. 

We are meeting at 715 Boylston St. in Back Bay, because the space I am able to rent there can fit more people. Hope you can make it!

*** A donation of $5 would be helpful to cover the room rental

PUBLIC TRANSIT INFO

Copley Station Green Line, Back Bay Station Orange Line, Bus: 

1, 10, 39

How to find us:

Look for Breather in the intercom system and you'll be buzzed up. Walk in the door and up the stairs to the second floor. Look for a green, round logo on the room opposite the nail salon.

Gary

Join us for our weekly Friday night tasting. It's always something delicious, educational and interesting. You can sign up for our weekly e-mail to get the details! (See the bottom of the homepage)

A NOTE FROM THE ORGANIZER:

Okay... We all love free stuff. That's why we're members of this group! So I'm going to post this as a recurring weekly event, as long as people are enjoying it. This event runs from 5pm till 8pm, but you can go for as much or as little time as you want. Please use the message area below to post if you're looking for people to join you. There are many restaurants in the North End, too, so feel free to post dinner requests, too. Let's make this page a collaborative web site!

Happy Free Tasting!

Gary

PS - If you like wine tastings, don't forget to check out the Central Bottle events, as well!

PPS - Please note that I have automatic reminders for this event turned off, since it is a repeating event.

results.description:
Biagio puts on a great party and has graciously invited the members of the Boston Social and Cultural Club.  Biagio rented the whole 2nd floor of the Wild Rover to make this an awesome private party.

PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its the starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink!

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist band to wear so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Special Wild Rover Venue Update: Members under age 21 are NOT admitted. They MUST CHECK Valid ID, Driver License or Passports. If you don't present it they can't let you in sorry. NO large luggage or suitcases/boxes allowed in this venue.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Biagio at the top of the stairs.
results.name: Boston Mix n Mingle 2016 Party for 120 Members from 9+ Meetup Groups

results.description:
Each week Anderson Comedy presents the best comedy from Boston and beyond, this week featuring special guest Mike Recine.

Mike Recine is either the smartest dumb guy or the dumbest smart guy in the room. He’s performed stand-up on Conan, written for the MTV Video Music Awards, performed as a New Face in the Montreal Just for Laughs Festival, and been nominated for Time Out New York’s Joke of the Year. Since his first open mic as a teenager in Jersey, he’s performed at nearly every comedy venue in NYC, blending observation and personal storytelling with a pitch-perfect dark wit. Catch him live across NYC to see one of the only guys Brooklyn hipsters and Jersey slobs can agree on.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EY2-LHBxL2g
http://www.mikerecine.com/videos/

18+ hosted by Rob Crean $5

results.description:
DELICIOUS DINNER

(and Take-Out)

Prepared by

DAVID SNIECKUS

- MACROBIOTIC CHEF AND COUNSELOR -

At 7 p.m.

at David’s, Margaret’s and Abigail's home in Newton, MA

February 12, 2016 Menu

Creamy Chickpea Soup

Wild Rice

Seitan, Burdock, and Carrot Sautéed with Kale

Wakame and Scallions/Chives with Mustard

Broccoli

Butternut Squash

Pickled Beets

Fresh Green Salads

Tahini Pudding and Berries

Kukicha Tea

(see detailed logistics below.)

**************************

Followed by a presentation from 8:15 to 10 pm on

Key Ideas from “A Course in Miracles” - with Ben Cohen

Students of “A Course in Miracles” often spend many years studying its 1200 pages of teachings.  It was written back in the 1960s as a guide to help people access their higher wisdom, learn to forgive themselves and others, and find inner peace in a chaotic world.  In this workshop, longtime student Ben Cohen will share several key ideas from the “Course”, and show how you can use these ideas to work through grievances and meet challenges that inevitably arise in daily life. 

A donation of $5 to $10 is requested. 

Ben Cohen is a certified Kripalu yoga teacher who has been teaching yoga in the Boston area for 23 years. He has a master’s degree in counseling psychology, and has been a student of A Course in Miracles for 25 years.  More information about Ben and his offerings can be found at his website, http://www.stretchways.com.

**************************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community and enjoy a healthy meal!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!

results.description:
Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/
results.how_to_find_us: At the picknic table next to the cubbies

Bowling with a twist!

Let's head over to Leo's Metro Bowl in lovely downtown Peabody for some blacklit bowling fun.  One cannot do this and NOT spend the whole time laughing.

Lanes are $28/hr with up to 6 people per lane (so under $5/hr per person).  Bowl a few strings and then regroup to rehydrate details later.

results.description:
Please join us to watch and discuss the third episode of BELIEF, a groundbreaking 7-part documentary series that aired on the OWN network in October.

BELIEF is an exploration of the power of our diverse belief systems, faith practices and cultural traditions that connect us to ourselves, sustain us through the most challenging times and bind us closer together in community with one another. Oprah has described this series as the very reason she founded a television network - to be able to share stories that connect people together.

This series highlights stories of people from around the world, diverse in their beliefs, but united by a deep desire to find purpose and meaning in their lives. It journeys to the far reaches of the world, illuminating sacred places and practices that will engage believers of any faith or none at all.

Our goal is that engaging in these questions and conversations together draws us to a place of deepened intercultural understanding and greater healing. Our hope is that this series can act as a catalyst to start and/or deepen intercultural and interfaith communication, trust building and partnership.

The gathering is free of charge. A facilitated discussion will follow the episode, inviting you to explore the beliefs and practices that bring meaning to your own life.

For more information about the series, or to watch the 2-minute trailer, visit http://beliefteam.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be right in the sanctuary...come in through the large glass doors in the front of the spiritual center on 13 Common Street in Natick Center across from the town green.
results.name: Community Watch Party: What Do You Believe?

group.name: Building Community @ Common Street Spiritual Center

results.description:
Come and make a coaster/decoration (3 ¾ square wood), light switch cover, or two mosaic pendants! Learn to use the mosaic wheeled cutters and nippers to shape glass pieces. Your project can be completed in one session and grout will be given to you to finish at home, or you can sign up for another session to complete your project in class. 

Ask your co-workers and/or friends to join you are make friends while you are there! We always have a wonderful group of women!  


Only $38 and all materials are included, just bring yourself and an adult beverage and friends if you like! You will leave with your own work of art and wonderful memories! 

Some come for one class and others stay for years! I offer four and ten-class packages at different time for all schedules. 

To register go to my website, www.cherylcohenmosaics.com and check out my amazing students on my Facebook page "Cheryl Cohen Mosaics!"
results.name: Mosaic Ladies' Night Out!

group.name: Cheryl Cohen Mosaics Art Center, Holliston

results.description:
This healing focuses on the resonance of being honest with yourself. When we are honest with ourself we resonate with rejuvenation. We stare at our shadow and see it dissolve. We come to recognize the light of our being.

Honesty ... The word originally comes from honor. This healing is about being willing to honor your self and to do that you have to be honest with what is serving you and what is not. It could be a way of thinking or a relationship in your life. Whatever it is, I will be opening up a space to acknowledge and transmute what is not you and align with your higher self.

Being honest is as hard or as easy as we make it. If we want to play games with ourselves and keep telling ourselves the same old story because we like to be the victim or feel comfortable, then transformation is going to take a while. But if we honestly engage our shadow, it dissolves through the love of our heart. We taste the fruit of liberation.

Also, we might try to actually channel Abraham Lincoln. 

Until next time, stay tuned :)

Brian

(781)[masked]

General Info:

So if you come to the Buddhist Temple for a sound healing, what can you expect? When you come in, you take your shoes off, then you walk to the Dharma Hall which will be on your immediate right at the top of the stairs. We'll start with a short introduction and discuss each of our intentions for how we want to work with the sound and then meditate for a few minutes to tune into each of our specific intentions. The general theme will be new years resolutions - specifically bringing in the vibrations we need! Then, everyone will sit or lie down on super comfy pillow mats (bring your own blanket) and we'll begin our journey into sound.

I start by playing the 500 pound cast-iron temple bell and then I move into the sweet sounds of my Tibetan singing bowls. What follows, I can't exactly say, as the sound decides what it wants to say. But you can expect to hear the rainbow voice, the sound of the overtone chant singing with the Tibetan bowls. You won't be able to tell which is which but this is all part of the dance. You will even feel what it's like to have the bowls played on you as the sound moves your energy where it needs to go. Tingshas, tuning forks, rattles and more are all part of the play as the sound moves you to rest at your destination without ever having moved. So, please, come and feel something unique. You never leave anywhere exactly the same, but when it comes to sound healing, you will leave sounding more like yourself :)

Please bring a blanket to enhance the comfort of your experience! Offerings are freely accepted :)
results.name: Honesty Healing

results.description:
Let's try something new!

One our sketchers recently suggested that we try doing something where we can sketch musicians performing in a club setting. Somebody suggested a place in Harvard, Mass called the Harvard General Store.  Here's their website: www.harvardgeneralstore.com/


They have a "Pub Night" on Fridays and are open to having us there sketching. There's a $10 cover to get in. I'll  reserve a table for us, bring a big bottle of cheap wine  and pay the "corking fee" so nobody would be obliged to buy drinks(unless they want to). They have coffee and all manner of other food and beverages including a dinner menu.


The band on Friday night is "Town Meeting." They play two sets, first one starting at 7:30pm.

So let's give it a try and see what happens!
results.name: Pub Sketching at the Harvard General Store

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: CANCELLED: Friday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

Co-hosted by Boston Atheists and Sunday Assembly Boston.

results.description:
• THE BOSTON DRUM CIRCLE

• A high-energy, FUN, celebration of drumming and community. For beginners who want to try something new, their friends, experienced drummers, dancers beginners to experts. NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

• We celebrate the traditions - rhythms that have built energy for hundreds of years for celebration, dance, ritual - just plain FUN! As well as whatever you bring to it!

• We gather together every other Friday evening. Check the schedule, grab your drum (or use ours) and have a blast!

We'll have drums to share, and support for newcomers, and energy for everyone.

Recent accolades!

“Great fun! Good rhythms. Very accommodating leader and group for this beginner. Will be back!”

Adrienne S 10/14

It was an amazing experience .. It was nice to feel free from the world and it's problems .. It's was so relaxing, can't wait to drum again ..thanks!

Justin 6/14

Was an awesome experience, I love hand drumming but really the main reason I came was to relieve stress due to family health situations and the circle definitely met my needs. Alan did a great job leading the circle with the drumming and the short history lessons about drumming and Africa. I will be coming back.

Paul 10/13

This Drum Circle is a great stress reliever after a long week of work and I wish it were every Friday night!! Boston Drum Cirlce attracts a wonderful , eclectic group of people that share the common bond of hand drumming. It is always wonderful to have the multi talented Fanta leading the Circle. Her singing, dancing, and drumming are all 5 star. Thank you for a great night of Drumming!

Carla 8/13

We can't wait to meet you! See you soon....

Alan and Fanta
results.name: Boston Drum Circle Friday at DrumConnection!

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Special Wild Rover Venue Update: Members under age 21 are NOT admitted. They MUST CHECK Valid ID, Driver License or Passports. If you don't present it they can't let you in sorry. NO large luggage or suitcases/boxes allowed in this venue.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html

results.description:
"What is Galentine's Day? Oh, it's only the best day of the year! Every February 13th, my lady friends and I leave our husbands and our boyfriends at home and we come and kick it, breakfast style. Ladies celebrating ladies. It's like Lilith Fair, minus the angst. Plus frittatas." Or waffles. Leslie would approve.

I'm thinking maybe everyone should bring a little something for everyone like it's 4th grade all over again. Whether it's a little something homemade, a Star Wars Valentine's Day card or a hug (a GOOD hug - none of that one armed crap - make me feel loved, damn it!), whatever your budget will allow, let's celebrate our lady friends! Even if we've never met before, you're awesome!
results.name: Galentine's Day!

results.description:
Friday nights are generally for more experienced students, as we work through some different parts of Fiore's works in a more open format.  New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (c[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

results.name: (Newton) Intermediate Longsword, Dagger and Grappling

results.description:
This is a lecture by Lance Keimig on the history of night photography. Very interesting and intriguing insights into what we have been doing all along. Understanding where it comes from and how it was discovered teaches us why we may be drawn to it and where we might take it.


This is a Friday evening, please be on-time and allow for enough time for traffic and finding parking. Parking near the main MIT entrance is sparse on the streets, but there is a small parking lot that often has empty spaces at night: 139 Mass Ave Visitor Lot, look for the Bank of America ATM. Parking garages are on Vassar street to west of Mass Ave.


Nocturne: Aqueduct of Izcuchaca,” Arequipa, Peru, Carlos and Miguel Vargas, ca. 1920


From Lance's lectures:

The night has always been associated with romance, mystery, fear, and the unknown. The nocturne has also been a natural subject for art. Albrecht Durer printed gruesome night scenes in the early sixteenth century. Rembrandt exploited night and darkness in his paintings to increase their emotional impact. During the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries, Goya, DeGericault, and Delacroix painted both horrific and romantic night scenes. Following in this tradition, photographers ventured into the night with their cameras within a few years of the discovery of photography.

The history of night photography is almost as long as the history of the medium itself. Only ten years after the introduction of the daguerreotype in 1839, John Adams Whipple daguerrotyped the moon through a telescope. In 1863, Whipple used electric lights to take night photographs of Boston Common [consider that the origin of the Greater Boston Night Photogs!! :-)]. However, it was not until the 1880's and the invention of the gelatin dry plate negative that night photography became a real possibility. However, aside from occasional experimentation, no single photographer made any kind of serious commitment to night photography until the early 1930s...

The topic is partly covered in Lance's book "Night Photography and Light Painting: Finding Your Way in the Dark", but the lecture will cover the topic in much more depth and with many more examples. Lance will have signed copies of the book available at the lecture.
results.name: Lecture: The history of Night photography- from daguerrotype to digital

results.description:
Dance with us from 8:00 pm - midnight at The First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church at 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA.

The fabulous, fun-filled event begins with a class from 8:00 to 9:15 and continues with dj'd dancing until  11:30 pm 

Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

Dance Friday is an activity of the non-profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out.  We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can  move in.

Chakradance with Christabeth Ingold<a href="http://dancefriday.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/sparkler.jpg"></a>Christabeth Ingold

Chakradance™ is a sweet dance with the soul. It’s an inward journey where you meet your self exactly where you are, and illuminate your 7 major chakras (energy centers). Each chakra is key holder to different parts of your self and your life, and may be holding old patterns that no longer serve you. In Chakradance™, you will balance, unblock, and free up your energy flow as you simply listen to the rhythm of your soul. When energy is flowing through you, you feel better and more clear emotionally, mentally, physically, and spiritually. You will also be guided through meditation and creating a mandala. Come enter into this beautiful waking dream, and possibly even meet your inner warrior!

DJ Mystical Michael has been a DJ for more than thirty years, beginning with turntables, then moving to CDs and now digital on his MacBook. He plays a global and eclectic mix of rhythms and tempos to provide opportunities for creative and fun movement including American Pop, R&B, Rock, Dance, Deep House, Deep Chillout and orchestral music.


Michael has been a Reiki Teaching Master and Counselor for more than twenty years. He is Director of Providence Zen Center in addition to a Life Coaching and Reiki Counseling private practice.

Leah C-S AKA DJ Leviathan is a local freelance photographer, artist and musician. She plays alt pop and texture pop, ranging from ecstatic to trance to rock.

For more information, please call: 6I[masked], go to <a>www.dancefriday.org,</a> or visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#/pages/Dance-Friday/[masked]?ref=ts

results.description:
Welcome future dance-a-holics!! Come dance with us THIS FRIDAY! If you want to learn to social dance and have a blast while doing it, please join us for a night of west coast swing. We offer a beginner ("Level 1", meant for those with little/no experience), intermediate ("Level 2", meant for those who have mastered the Left Side Pass, Right Side Pass, and Sugar Push), and advanced ("Level 3", meant for those who have mastered whips, tucks, and fundamental techniques) classs from 8:30-9:30pm. If you like it and feel like sticking around, there is a west coast social dance from 9:15-12pm.

You don't need a partner.

You don't need to have any previous dance experience.

You can have two left feet.

This is all about having a blast while learning something new that you can actually use in your real life!

WHAT IS WEST COAST SWING?

West Coast Swing (WCS) is a modern, partnered social dance done all over the world.

It is danced to a wide variety of music, including R&B, Rock, Blues, country and Lyrical: exactly what’s on the radio today and at functions you attend!

It fits in small spaces like bars, crowded dance floors—even your living room.

You do not need a partner to get started.  Most people come by themselves or with friends.

Once you’re hooked, there are places to dance WCS every night of the week in the Boston area.

People of all ages dance WCS.
results.name: Second-Friday-of-the-Month West Coast Swing Classes & Social Dance!

I've driven by this place 100 times and finally went there today.  I mapped out a 4 mile route along the North River, through the woods and around Gordon Pond on some neat boardwalks. It's mostly flat but there are a couple of hills to make it intersting. See pictures below.

Snowhoes are recommended but you could probably get away with Boots with YakTraks or Microspikes. If the snow is still soft I plan on using my XC skis. I'll go slow so we all should be able to stay together.

It's a very scenic route so bring your camera/smart phone. I would suggest bringing  a snack and some water.

Please dress warmly it's supposed to be in the 20s.

Apres Hike festivities at the Tinker's Son Pub right across the street.

Look for this sign at the intersection of rt 123 and Dover St

The Trustees of the Reservations is a wonderful organization. I first joined them 7 years ago. They do a wonderful job of preserving some of our states most beautiful treasures. Please consider supporting them. http://www.thetrustees.org/

Here's a few more pictures to tempt you some more to join us.

Open Board Gaming.  For an idea of what games we play check the Top Board Games from BoardGameGeek.com.

What is better than a Board Game event?  Playing board games with your SO/partner the (day before) St. Valentines day.  No candle-light board gaming - the wax sticks to the gaming surface.

Your partner doesn't play board games?  No worries, we are scheduling the event early, so that you can return home to cook a nice dinner and celebrate.  Have not found a group-buy provider for flowers.


No partner?  Even better!  I am temporarily in the same boat.  Adriana left me alone with half of the kids while she takes care of a few family matters back home.  I am taking the opportunity to schedule as many game events as possible (she can't complaint).

I did scheduled the event from 10am to midnight, but feel free to drop later or leave earlier as your schedule permits.  

Bring snacks and drinks.  When people get hungry during the event, please volunteer to organize an order from a local eatery delivery service.

Since we are reserving a large enough time slot - feel free to schedule those longer games via the meetup comments.  You can use the game table upstairs for one of those longer games if you want to.  Ideas:  Axis & Allies on the 8'x4' map, Twilight Imperium, Napoleon, X-Wing Epic Ship, etc.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed.

results.description:
(a set of 6 Saturday classes)


Always wanted to learn how they really fought in the middle ages? Forget any ideas about crude battering on armour; the successful warrior strikes to the gaps and the openings of his or her opponent's attacks, and supplements this with disarms, throws, and other techniques which secure the advantage over larger or stronger attackers.

Around the year 1400, Fiore dei Liberi trained medieval knights and squires, and authored multiple books of medieval combat, some of which have survived to the present day. His method, L'Arte d'Armizare (the Art of Bearing Arms), shows an integrated and cross-referenced system of sword, dagger, grappling, spear & lance, pollaxe and other weapons on foot and on horseback, with and without armour, and easily dispels any illusions that medieval combat was about unskilled strength.

Our beginners' course is six linked classes that give the basic techniques and vocabulary of L'Arte, and enables men and women to begin regular unarmoured training and learning.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

So, come join the scholars and combatants of our company!

(The price shown is for the set of all six classes (Jan 9, 16, 23, 30, Feb 6 and 13) and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  We'll send an email with some class materials before the first session.)

Monday  February 15                10am-7pm,
Tuesday, Weds, Thurs & Friday
  February 16-19            1pm–9pm
Sunday     February 21                11am–5:30pm

Admission

Adults $15.00  ( SEE 1/2 Price Tickets info above from
  Boats and Motors in Wakefield, MA
  until February 11th)
Children Age 15 years and under Free (when accompanied by an Adult).

Please note: Credit and debit cards will be accepted for ticket purchases at the show. A Citizen’s Bank ATM is available in the show lobby for your cash needs. You may also purchase your tickets on line.

Parking Information

BCEC South Parking Lot:

To access from Summer Street, turn onto Eastside Drive, drive past the valet area, and continue straight along the side of the building. At the end of the building, make a right and go down the ramp. At the bottom of the ramp, turn left and you will see the entrance to the South Parking lot in front of you.

------------------------------------------------


Looking forward to seeing you soon.

Peter D

2 Samuel, of course, picks up where 1 Samuel leaves off!  We're continuing this study, now focused on the leadership of David as God establishes Israel, and more importantly, establishes his promises to build David a house, granting him a kingdom in which David's son will rule forever.

Join us as we investigate the story of 2 Samuel and the different lessons for us!

results.description:
Boston Black Pride in collaboration with "GLAD," "The L.O.C.S. Collective," and "PQWOC," present to you a Soul Brunch Buffet followed by a Tea Dance. There will be a live DJ for our Tea Dance, and of course an all you can eat buffet. 

Buffet items include: scrambled eggs, grits, waffles or french toast, turkey bacon, breakfast sausage links, ham, fried chicken, BBQ ribs, rice and beans, collard greens, candied yams, mac and cheese, fresh fruit, and assorted desserts.

Advance tickets are $30 which include the buffet, gratuity, and the tea dance. It is a cash bar.

After 1pm, entry into the Tea Dance is $10 at the door


PURCHASE TICKETS: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=JRC4W3FHXUZMA
results.name: Soul Brunch Buffet and Tea Dance

results.description:
Hey Craft Beer Lovers,

The last tour was a blast, so let's do it again! This time let's go to the North Shore  and visit four stops with great craft beer our focus. The list of stops is below. I will be renting a van so space is limited. Your ticket will include pick-up and drop off at Assembly Row and a designated driver for the trip. Looking forward to spending a fun day with you all!

Craft Beer Stops:

11:20am pick-up at Assembly Road (free parking and metro available)

12:00pm –  Far From The Tree Cider

1:30pm –  Cape Ann Brewing  VIP access and "story time" with owner Jeremy Goldberg. Jeremy will give us a few stories about some of his beer on tap and we get VIP access to the brewpub and maybe even the canning line. 

4:00pm – Newburyport Brewing

4:45pm – Riverwalk Brewing

6:30pmish – Drop-off at Assembly Row

*Times are approximate and could change due to traffic.  You will be paying for your own food and craft beer. Van will leave promptly at 11:30am. 

Cheers,

Mark McCurdy

PS. I will have insulated growler bags for the preferred price of $20.00, normally $35.00.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Red Van...details to follow.

results.description:
RSVP is closed. Only by e-mail please.


This Meetup is intended for Intermediate +/ Advanced level players with firm understanding of game strategy. Players are required to know how to play a 6-2 or 5-1 formation. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please send an email to Bob using the following  URL

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=191903979


In the email, confirm that you know how to play in a 5-1 or 6-2 offense, and mention your preferred position (if any)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked]

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $8 membership fee that is valid for a day.

As always, please remember: - Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP) - If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join. Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.

Here are the details:

2. WHEN: February 13th, 2016 (Saturday) from 1:00 PM - 3: 00 PM


3. WHERE:

We'll meet at the Braintree Library in the small conference room upstairs:


Thayer Public Library
798 Washington Street
Braintree, MA

4. WHY: Improve our technical knowledge and network. (Bring your business cards!)

5. ToDo: Come prepare with game ideas and technologies.


6. Format: Presentation, demonstration, programming and discussions. This is a techie-led event. Bring your laptops!

7. Misc: Bring others interested with you!

results.description:
Note: 

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php 

You can get help for the following Data Science Specialization Classes:  (from https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1?utm_medium=courseDescripTop )

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone
results.how_to_find_us: Depending on the interest level, we may meet @CIC or HackReduce or Microsoft NERD
results.name: In-depth R Programming Using Coursera (with  1-on-1  expert help)

results.description:
This class is intended for Hindi enthusiasts who wish to enjoy the language beyond basic daily conversational use.  You should be comfortable speaking and reading the Devanagari script, even if limited in vocabulary. (Usually this means a year of familiarity with Hindi. ) 

Each member should bring a short piece of writing ,whether it is their own, a clipping from a news article, or words from a song or poem. 

During the study group, there will be an emphasis on using the Devanagari script. Another emphasis will be to avoid English words where Hindi words do exist. Urdu substitutes are always acceptable as an alternative.


Those who are native speakers or speak Hindi well are encouraged to join and it is hoped that they assist in vocabulary building for the group. This is Hindi learning for all!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the escalator upstairs, take a sharp right, and walk back towards the magazine section.  We will be at a table there.
results.name: Hindi Reading Group

results.description: Valentine's Day.....calls to the mind images of love and other things romantic in nature.....but what about crystals? Ever wonder how crystals could help with love? Come join Rachel in a workshop on Love and Crystals and learn about specific crystals whose metaphysical properties are known to promote and support self love, Universal love and the more popular (for this holiday) romantic love. We will explore all three kinds of love and the benefits of each as well as why all three are needed in ones life for balance. For each type of love we will focus on a few crystals that can help you heal in that area, attract more of it into your life, or support what is already there.  Remember, crystals don't do the work for you but we can learn how to use them as a tool to help you on your path. Crystal blessings and I hope to see you there! Doors open at 12:45 fee $20.
results.name: Love and Crystals Valentines Day Special Workshop

results.description:
EXPO SEMINAR SOLD OUT!

Visionary Vintners: The Drouhin Family's Story of Elegance and Excellence in Burgundy and Oregon with Winery Keynote Veronique Drouhin

Come join me what promises to be a very special seminar / tasting from the respected negociant Drouhin in Burgundy and now Oregon. The presenter for this seminar is Veronique Drouhin, one of the Expo keynote speakers. The tasting includes two 1er Cru wines, already a reason to attend. But in addition we will also be tasting two Grand Cru Burgundy wines, a white Chablis and a 12-year old Chambertin 'Clos de Beze' red !! 

Not to be missed! 

Price is $60 payable to Boston Wine Expo (click here for ticketing)

Note, RSVPing here does NOT sign you up for this Boston Wine Expo seminar. You MUST reserve your spot by paying via the Expo web side. Click above to pay. 

I haven't set a limit on RSVPs, but be aware that these seminars are selling out fast, so you should book quickly to ensure a spot.

More postings coming...

About the Seminar

Join 2015 Boston Wine Expo keynote speaker, winemaker Veronique Drouhin as she presents current releases and library selections from Maison Drouhin and Domaine Drouhin Oregon. Veronique will be joined by her brother, Laurent Drouhin, who oversees the U.S. Market. Their experiences in both Burgundy and Oregon make for an unparalleled perspective on the family's approach to vineyards and wine.

The tasting will include: 

• 2013 Domaine Drouhin 'Arthur' Chardonnay, Willamette

• 2012 Maison Joseph Drouhin Chablis 'Les Clos' Grand Cru

• 2011 Maison Joseph Drouhin Chassagne-Montrachet 'Morgeot' Premier Cru 'Marquis de la Guiche'

• 2014 and 2002 Domaine Drouhin Pinot Noir, Willamette

• 2012 and 2000 Domaine Drouhin 'Laurene' Pinot Noir, Willamette

• 2013 Maison Joseph Drouhin Gevrey-Chambertin

• 2006 Maison Joseph Drouhin Chambolle-Musigny Premier Cru

• 2002 Maison Joseph Drouhin Chambertin 'Clos de Beze' Grand Cru

The Drouhin family business was established in 1880 by Joseph Drouhin in Beaune, FRANCE. Over the years, the Drouhin estate has become one of the most impressive in Burgundy. The majority of Drouhin's estate is comprised of prestigious Premier and Grand Cru vineyards located throughout the Cote d'Or and Chablis. 

In 1987, with an eye to the future and a clear appreciation of the Willamette Valley's potential, patriarch Robert Drouhin established Domaine Drouhin Oregon. His daughter, Véronique has been at the helm of DDO ever since. The wines were excellent from the first release and continue at a high level. 

About Boston Wine Expo

Boston Wine Expo happens every year and currently comprises an entire week of festivities celebrating wine, food and culture from the greatest wine-growing regions of the world.

• A weeklong series of events

• Outstanding cuisine from more than 40 restaurants

• Expanded education series

• Nightly vintner dinners at top restaurants

• VIP and Grand Cru Wine Lounge, barrel samplings and vertical tastings

Get more details here:

http://www.wine-expos.com/page.cfm/Link=1/t=m/goSection=1


There is a huge--as in thousands of people--Grand tasting Sat. and Sunday, and a VIP tasting as well, which is fairly expensive. The Seminar Series is the best value for dollar in my experience and often a tremendous experience.  

Boston Wine Expo 2014

Seaport World Trade Center and Seaport Hotel
200 Seaport Boulevard
Boston, MA 02210
(877)[masked]
Metro: Silver Line Waterfront (SL1)

Parking is available ($$$) at the Seaport Hotel or in lots surrounding the area.

Look forward to seeing you there!

-jim

results.description:
A Raisin in the Sun is a 1961 drama film, starring Sidney Poitier, Ruby Dee, Claudia McNeil, Diana Sands, Roy Glenn, and Louis Gossett, and adapted from the play of the same name by Lorraine Hansberry. It follows a black family that wants a better life away from the city.

Lena Younger (McNeil) is a strong, proud woman who has raised a family in a crowded apartment on the South Side of Chicago. Her son Walter Lee (Poitier) works as a chauffeur; intelligent and ambitious but impulsive and often angry, he desperately wants to get ahead in a world that offers him few opportunities. His wife Ruth (Dee) takes in laundry to help make ends meet and watches over their son. Younger daughter Beneatha (Sands) is a college student who wants to become a doctor and often speaks of searching for her cultural identity. On the death of her husband, Lena becomes the beneficiary of a $10,000 life insurance payment, and suddenly the family is in conflict over how the money should be spent.


This program is sponsored by the Friends of the Thomas Crane Public Library.
results.name: Classic Film Series: A Raisin in the Sun

results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback.  We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 4:00, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.) Also, feel free to bring any writings or objects you want to share as part of your anti-racism thinking and work.

We generally schedule one accountability/support session each month. If you are unable to attend and want to be part of accountability, we will consider scheduling an additional session for the month, or choosing a time that works for you in the next month.


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role.  The requirement still applies: you must have attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

Note: We welcome intrepid winter bike riders, though there are not many good spots for parking bikes, and bicycles are prohibited in the building.  We apologize for the inconvenience.
results.name: February Accountability and Support Session

results.description:
We're doing a fun 10-week training program! All levels are welcome, and you don't need to be able to make it every week. In week 1, we timed ourselves in a few key events (e.g. 100 freestyle), and now we're doing a training program to get ourselves faster. At the end of 10 weeks we'll time ourselves again and see how much we've improved! If you can't make a week, don't worry, you can still come to the other weeks.


The 10 weeks will include clinics on technique, flip turns, and any special requests, as well as some good sets to get us swimming faster. If there's a race you're targeting and want to work on that distance or event, let us know and we can help tailor the workouts for you.

We go across the street for pizza (or other food if you don't eat pizza) every week after the swim. Save time to join us! We usually finish up by about 4:30pm.


---------------


The pool opens at 2pm, so we meet to go in at 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)
