results.description:
Join single members of Social Fun (SF), South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC), and other meetup groups TBD for a Saturday afternoon of socializing with other singles while bowling as we start the new year!  O'Lindy's is fun yet laidback and is a great place to bowl, play pool, and socialize with friends.  Join us for a couple of hours on Saturday afternoon as we socialize and bowl with other singles this Valentine's Day weekend.

O'Lindy's sells snacks and beverages, including alcohol.  No outside beverages are allowed due to the liquor license.  Normally, the cost is $4.50 per person per string (we generally bowl two strings) and the shoe rental is $2.50 per person.  However, today we are paying $10 flat for 2 strings and shoe rental which is a savings of $1.50.  Please arrive between 2-2:15pm as we will start bowling @ 2:15pm.

O'Lindy's is located on Route 53(SB-side) in Quincy along the bus line and a couple of miles from the Quincy Center T Station.  They have parking lots both in front of their building and directly across the street. 

"Single" is defined as not in a relationship or dating one person on a "regular" basis.  You are available to date others if you so choose and are otherwise unattached or held back.  This is a great opportunity for us to meet singles within the participating meetup groups listed below.  (If you are interested in having your group participate please contact Angela no later than Tuesday, February.  She must be a member of your group in order for your group to be considered.  A limited number of groups will be able to join SF and SSHBSC and you need to be able to bring 3-6 people.)

Social Fun (SF): www.meetup.com/socialfun

South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC): www.meetup.com/socialnetwork-1414

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

South Shore SINGLES Bowling Social!!

Saturday, February 13th @ 2-4:30pm

O'Lindy's

170 Quincy Avenue (Route 53 SB)

Quincy, MA 02169

Phone #[masked]

Website: http://olindysbowling.com/

Meeting Location:  Please pay and get your shoes at the front desk and then head to our lanes thereafter.  Look for a meetup sign and bowling lane assignment sheet.  The reservation is under "Angela" and "Meetup."

Host/Organizer: Angela ~ Co-Hosts Welcome!

Min/Max: Minimum of 12 people 48 hours prior to the event; max of 40 total across all groups as we have reserved 6 lanes for a total of 36 people.  If you are not planning to bowl but want to join us to socialize please note it in the Comments and your RSVP Q&A. 

Guests: 1 Single Adult 21+ per member now welcome!

Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for our meals in cash allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone. 


Cost/Fees: $10 for 2 strings and shoes which is a $1.50 savings off the normal cost of $4.50/string plus $2.50 to rent bowling shoes.  You will pre-pay for bowling and shoes upon arrival.  [If you are joining us to socialize only please be advised we are looking for $3 and you need to note that you are not bowling in the Event Conversations section &/or in your RSVP Q&A.   Otherwise, you could be charged the full $10 by the bowling alley.]   If you want to make your annual $10 voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio and it will cover your cost for tonight's event.  Biagio requests a $10 donation after attending your 3rd event.  (If half the people who attended 3+ events actually made the donation it would be a one-time request.  Alas, not so.)

RSVP Deadline: Saturday, February 13th @ 9am ~ Any changes made after this time will be considered a No-Show so please finalize your RSVP by this time.  Please note RSVPs close @ Noon on the site so no changes can be made after that time.

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD

No-Show Policy:  People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.  Please be advised that any Assistant Organizer (AO) or the Group Organizer (GO) can remove a member from Social Fun who has 3 No-Shows in the past 3 months.  Additionally, Organizers may disallow members with 2 or more "No Show" marks from attending their events.  ***Please keep in mind that we are reserving lanes based on the number of people who RSVP Yes to attend and if we show-up missing more than 10% of the people it has an adverse affect on everyone else attending as well as the venue as we are planning based on RSVPs and if there's a Waitlist (WL) then you are taking away a spot for someone else if you do not change your RSVP when you are no longer able to attend.***

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Parking: Free parking on-site and in their extended lot across the street.  If lots are full drive north on Route 53 to the next set of lights where you will take a right (onto Scammell Street) and then you can take a left into the big free parking lot where Quincy Credit Union and a gym are located.  (Please do not park in the strip mall or Citizens Bank parking lots.)

Directions/Location Overview:  This is located on Route 53 NB in Quincy about 2 miles from the Braintree line and less than 1/2 mile from Kam Man Plaza (where Bradlees used to be over 2 decades ago).  This is also on the bus line which you can catch from the Quincy Center T station.  For exact directions, please go to their website or google map it.



Please Note: If you are a member of Social Fun or any other group participating, please RSVP Yes w/ one group and No w/ the other group(s).  I can give you credit for attending for all groups but only if you RSVP in some way w/ SF as it's very challenging to find people in that group to add them in when editing attendance.

Saturday, Feb13, 2:00-4:00p.m.
Common Street Spiritual Center

Upstairs Meditation Room

Happy Valentine's month! 

We're all looking for love, a lasting love that is fully available within. The phenomenon called deeksha is helping humankind find what they are seeking – on their own path and in their own way. This sacred transfer of energy causes a neurobiological change to help awaken the brain from separation consciousness. When this happens all relationships improve!

Join me and our special guest Lien Zayhowski of Oneness Massachusetts as she shares with us this powerful form of deeksha. First will be doing Chakra Dhyana Chant to clear the seven energy centers of the body to prepare open us to receive this grace. Because this event is limited to 15 you must RSVP

Thanks and we look forward to seeing you!

- Eat Like You Care by Gary Francione

- Mind If I Order the Cheeseburger by Sherry F. Colb

- The Happy Vegan by Russell Simmons

- The End of Dieting by Joel Fuhrman,  M.D.

Please vote by Dec 6th to allow for enough time to read the book!


And the winner is... Eat Like You Care by Gary Francione!  :) 

We will be reading Eat Like You Care by Gary Francione for this book club discussion.  

Thank you,

Victoria

results.description:
The Boston Skeptics Book Club book for February is "This Is Why We Can't Have Nice Things: Mapping the Relationship between Online Trolling and Mainstream Culture" by Whitney Phillips, Assistant Professor of Literary Studies and Writing in the Liberal Studies Department of Mercer University's Penfield College. According to the descriptive summary on Amazon, "Internet trolls live to upset as many people as possible, using all the technical and psychological tools at their disposal. They gleefully whip the media into a frenzy over a fake teen drug crisis; they post offensive messages on Facebook memorial pages, traumatizing grief-stricken friends and family; they use unabashedly racist language and images. They take pleasure in ruining a complete stranger's day and find amusement in their victim's anguish. In short, trolling is the obstacle to a kinder, gentler Internet."

Just the thing to stir up heart-warming outrage to counteract a cold winter's day.

Join us for discussion, snacks, gratuitous Star Trek references and other nice things on a cold Saturday afternoon in February.

Amazon link (provided for reference purposes only): http://amazon.com/gp/product/B00VY1P3Q0

(Photo of a bunch of my neice and nephew's nice thing courtesy of me.)
results.name: Boston Skeptics' Book Club: This Is Why We Can't Have Nice Things

results.description:
FINDING LOVE THROUGH ONLINE DATING: HOW TO CREATE AN IRRESISTIBLE PROFILE AND MORE (This is a multi-group meetup event)


You are invited to join us for a special Online Dating Workshop given by Dating & Relationship Coach and Therapist, Susan Trotter, Ph.D. We will have space reserved for us in the bar in Violet Thorn as well as in the area in the lounge area. This is an amazing opportunity as Susan has graciously offered to donate her time to lead this workshop. The only cost to attendees is $15 per person to cover the cost of food that we will order for the event. Cash bar will be available.

Join us on this afternoon before Valentine's Day to meet new people and walk away with a variety of tools that you will be able to utilize immediately and in the future in your search for love. The focus of this fun and interactive workshop is how to have more fun and greater success with online dating. In the process, you will learn how to:

- create fabulous online profiles (including both photos and text) 

- write good emails

- move forward to a phone conversation

- prepare for a fantastic first date and beyond!

Susan is an amazing Dating and Relationship Coach. She also has a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology and has been a therapist for over 20 years. Her extensive background in psychology, therapy and coaching gives her a unique perspective in helping people who are looking to develop new relationships, strengthen existing relationships, or process past relationships. With a clear understanding of the importance of emotional well-being and connection, Susan is able to successfully coach her clients to achieve greater joy and satisfaction in their relationships.

You can buy your ticket via Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/finding-love-through-online-dating-how-to-create-and-irresistible-profile-and-more-tickets-21454445825

<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/finding-love-through-online-dating-how-to-create-and-irresistible-profile-and-more-tickets-21454445825"></a>

results.description:
EXPO SEMINAR SOLD OUT

Barolo -- the Undisputed King of Italy

Barolo; need I say more?  With its intense nose of tar and roses, constantly evolving in the glass, this northern Italian Nebbiolo is the most stunning red wine of Italy, perhaps of the world (wow! really Jim? yes).

Come join me for a rich and varied Barolo tasting of top vintages from the last decade from some of the top producers.

Price is $45 payable to Boston Wine Expo (click here for ticketing)

Note, RSVPing here does NOT sign you up for this Boston Wine Expo seminar. You MUST reserve your spot by paying via the Expo web side. Click above to pay.

I haven't set a limit on RSVPs, but be aware that these seminars are selling out fast, so you should book quickly to ensure a spot.

This event is part of a series of BostonWine events focused on the Wine Expo Seminars Series. More postings coming...

About the Seminar

No wine evokes a passion for the land and its wines more than Barolo. One hundred and eighty-one crus spread over eleven communes, all planted with just one magical grape variety: Nebbiolo. In many ways the one grape planted in subtly varied sites of the region resembles Burgundy. But unlike Burgundy, prior to the mid-18th century, the reds here were vinified into a sweet wine of low alcohol content. Count Camillo Benso of Cavour recognized that the wines could be improved and invited French enologist Louis Oudart, to consult. Oudart produced the first dry Nebbiolo wines and set the stage for greatness. Since that time Barolo has achieved a well-deserved reputation for aromatic, deeply flavored, complex reds justifiably referred to as 'the King of Wines and the Wine of Kings'. 

This seminar will feature a tasting of six Barolos from notable producers: 

• 2008 Giacosa Barolo 'Falletto'

• 2007, Viberti Barolo 'La Volta'

• 2010 Viberti Barolo 'Buon Padre'

• 2010 Chiarlo Barolo 'Tortoniano'

• 2010 Gagliardo Barolo 'Serre'

• 2011 Chiarlo Barolo 'Cerequio'

About Boston Wine Expo

Boston Wine Expo happens every year and currently comprises an entire week of festivities celebrating wine, food and culture from the greatest wine-growing regions of the world.

• A weeklong series of events

• Outstanding cuisine from more than 40 restaurants

• Expanded education series

• Nightly vintner dinners at top restaurants

• VIP and Grand Cru Wine Lounge, barrel samplings and vertical tastings

Get more details here:

http://www.wine-expos.com/page.cfm/Link=1/t=m/goSection=1


There is a huge--as in thousands of people--Grand tasting Sat. and Sunday, and a VIP tasting as well, which is fairly expensive. The Seminar Series is the best value for dollar in my experience and often a tremendous experience.  

Boston Wine Expo 2014

Seaport World Trade Center and Seaport Hotel
200 Seaport Boulevard
Boston, MA 02210
(877)[masked]
Metro: Silver Line Waterfront (SL1)

Parking is available ($$$) at the Seaport Hotel or in lots surrounding the area.

Look forward to seeing you there!

-jim

results.description:
Be there or be square. Last stop is a multi meetup thanks to dance queen Meeka.

Come early leave early. Come late leave late, we stick to schedule.
  Don't have a sweetheart?  Well look for one at this Meetup..!

This is a MIX & MINGLE, my pretties! we mean to keep shifting chairs so you can meet who you want and get away from who you don't want. 
  
And don't whine about the walking, that is part of the Mixing! Getting trapped behind tables? Glued to seats? Won't happen, no thanks, my lovelies!  ("My lovelies" is normal in Aussie language). 

Bring cash and pay as you go. 

You aren't expected to order a drink at every bar & I don't advise you do. Secret of the pub crawls = you overwhelm the waitstaff so they are unable to pressure you to order drinks. Just get some water and a slice of lemon and don't get drunk, this is not like the Boston crawls where they get sloshed. 
  
SCHEDULE:

5:15--Grendel's half price food menu with the purchase of a drink. Best deal in Harvard Square. No need to order food.

6:00--Beat Brasserie back right corner of the venue at the bar.

6:45-- Felipe's a new place authentic Mexican affordable cuisine ...& BEER! At the bar there. NO pressure to order food or drinks. 

7:30--Sinclair. At the bar. Ignore the people at reception about tables.

8:15 --Park on 59 JFK St. (It is not a garage it is a bar slash restaurant). Have a look at the unique surreal rooms. http://parkcambridge.com/

9:00--Fire and Ice on Church St. 

9:45 --Hong Kong 2nd floor at the bar followed by DANCIN' -- no cover. WE WILL BE JOINING multiple Stupid Cupid meetups there then.  Host Meeka will be in charge of those.  
  DO NOT COMPLAIN ABOUT THE WALKING these places are all close the walking is intentional because this is a Mix & Mingle.
results.name: Stupid Cupid Pub Crawl Harvard Sq. Then Dancing.

results.description:
We'll be joining the beginning of a pub crawl also posted to Social Fun at Grendel's.
http://www.meetup.com/SocialFun/events/228399586/

BTW I recommend the daily specials list because that food is the freshest.

You must get there as soon as you can, seating and waitstaff will become problematic otherwise. Try and order as a group to make it easier for all, but bring cash and pay as you go! 

Why Reverse Happy Hour? Because when Grendel's was founded Federal law instituted the law saying drinks could not be discounted so, instead, Grendel's decided to take half off it's menu, amounting to the same discount! Is that cool or not!?

Grendel's still has its amazing half price food menu tradition super-unusual in now- swanky Harvard Square.
  Special lasts from 5 to 7:30 however, it is best to get your orders in early, staff gets very busy soon & seating gets dicey. 

If you don't want to order food there will be no pressure to. Half price menu is only valid with the purchase of a $3.50 drink. Drinks are not half price they are full price.   
  
Take the Red Line to Harvard Square. Parking= Charles Hotel parking garage, 1 Bennett St. Grendel's'll give you a $2.00 off parking validation for this location.

PAY AS YOU GO. Please bring cash to help with your friendly wait staff & don't forget to tip.

https://encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQyi_DwT0wc83F9tZTlmxFfEEWaqTgqiiTEIlBMUU490ZuKH68S
results.how_to_find_us: Host Duncan will be wearing a black kangaroo skin hat.
results.name: Grendel's Den Reverse Happy Hour-- Best Deal in Harvard Square.

results.description:
Yummy Ryan Renolds stars in what looks to be a funny action moviewith lots of bad one liners...how can you say no to that?

Showtime is at 7, I will be at the theater by 6.  I will be near ropes near the concession stand until they let us into the inner lobby.  We will go in for seats as soon as they let us.  If you want to sit with the group, do not be late. 

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance. Tickets are on sale now on Fandango.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Based upon Marvel Comics’ most unconventional anti-hero, "Deadpool" tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life.

results.description:
4 Noteworthy Facts About Malbec


Malbec (sometimes called Côt and Auxxerois) is from France where it grows in the Sud-Ouest. The thick-skinned grape is a natural cross of two esoteric varieties that are from Montpellier (in Languedoc-Roussilon) and Gaillac in the Sud-Ouest. Today the majority of France’s Malbec is found in Cahors, a small town on a switchback river that gently flows towards Bordeaux.


Malbec’s Blind Tasting Tell: Look for a magenta-tinged rim. Malbec wine is a deep purple-red that is nearly opaque, similar to Syrah and Mourvedre. However, Malbec wines will often have a bright magenta rim. A tell!


Malbec Loves High Elevation.  In lower elevations, Malbec grapes struggle to produce the acidity they need to create great tasting and long lasting wine. High elevation areas with a wide diurnal temperature shift (ie hot days, cold nights) make the grapes produce more acidity.

Not As Much Oak as You Might Think.  Because of Malbec’s bold flavors and richness, many wine tasters believe that industrious use of oak is employed. Not true! In the $9-12 range you’ll find most Argentine Malbec to have only about 6 months of oak aging. 10-12 months of oaking Malbec will give it that classic ‘blueberry’ smell. Some Malbec wines are aged for a long time (18-20 months), but you have to pay to play. Expect to spend around $24+ for Reserva Argentine Malbec and more for US Malbec.


(source:  Wine Folly http://winefolly.com/review/what-is-malbec-wine/  )


Please bring: a bottle of Malbec (or mostly Malbec) in the $15-$25 range, in a paper wine bag, 4 glasses, and some go-with food to share.

In case of bad weather, please keep an eye on this board and your email so that you know whether or not it has to be cancelled.
results.name: Get Warm and Cozy with Malbec

If you went to our semi-formal dance here last year you will remember what a great success it was. It was so nice to see everyone get dressed up, have a little wine and then dance the night away. So we're going  to do it again Valentines Day Style... Everyone is invited, singles, couples and those in between ;-)

Please keep your RSVP updated. Capacity is 100 peeps and I anticipate it being a sellout event. Last year we had 91 attendees despite the ridiculous amount of snow and ultra-freezing temps. I will be posting this event in 4 groups which I will post in the comment section.

............................................................................................................

Dress up Cocktail Party with Live Piano for VALENTINES DAY !

LOVE IS IN THE AIR ... CAN YOU FEEL IT?

So we'll have live piano from 8-845 ish and then I'll start playing dance music.  Semi-formal Means Dress to Impress. Men - collard shirts a must and jackets preferred. Good looking Jeans OK but dress them up with a jacket. No sneakers or work boots please. Ladies... you know what to do. You goils always look nice.  

It's not a singles event but most are. Couples are certainly invited though.  Age range - most are between 40-55.

Our last martini party was a great success and we'll be doing another one soon but the folks at President's are interested in having our group on a regular basis.

Some food will be available for purchase. 

AS USUAL - NO COVER CHARGE !!


 Optional Wine flight - We are going to do wine flights, 2 oz pours of each  of the four wines - $10 for 4 samples

results.description:
Hi everyone! I sent out an email with the below information, but am also posting as an 'event' so that its easy for anyone to RSVP and we know how many chairs to set up at the planning table. This will be an hour meeting at one of the tables during the upcoming Game Night event.

Spring is getting closer and with it many opportunities for fun and fellowship with our brothers and sisters in Christ!

Do you have ideas on what Singles in Christ can do this year to be more valuable to its members? Would you like to help out with the group and contribute your talents and energy to providing more opportunities for Christian singles to meet, fellowship, provide encouragement and grow together?

We're setting up a table at Game Night to have a meeting for anyone interested in helping out at our upcoming game night on Saturday, Feb 13th! We'll meet to discuss ideas from 7:30-8:30 with anyone interested in helping out with the group. That will give everyone time to enjoy the potluck before the planning meeting, and time to join a game table after the meeting.

If you would like to help but are not sure what help would be needed, here are a few ideas. Many more are possible with your imagination of what the group can become!

- Event organizers - post an event and be the contact person for the event

- Welcome team - send encouraging welcome messages to new members and help answer any questions they might have

- Prayer team - help keep track of prayer requests and help others to remember to pray for those in need

- Marketing/tech team - help think of ideas for helping other Christian singles find the group, surveying members, other ideas?

- Special talent or resources?
> Are you a musician or DJ who could help with an event?
> Do you have skills that would be interesting to teach others (eg dancing, cooking, outdoor, etc)?
> Do you have resources that could be available for an event? (eg kayaks, camping facility, location where an event could be held, etc)

- Planning - would you like to help keep track of things we can do, resources that are available, people in the group who can help, etc?)

If you can't make it to the planning meeting, but still are interested in helping out, please let me know. We would love to have you on the team!

We're really look forward to hearing your ideas and providing more opportunities for spiritual growth and connection! If we can all do a little, there will be a lot of great opportunities available that we can all enjoy together!

in Christ,
Micha
results.name: 2016 Planning Meeting - at a table during Game Night

results.description:
Let's get together and celebrate V-Day with style! 

Whether you plan to dance all night or seduce her/them over a fancy dinner next day, this dance party will fit your mood. This is your chance to celebrate with new people and meet someone(s) special before V-Day! And it's also an excellent opportunity for people in relationships to rekindle their flames and make every day Valentine's Day. 

It is that time of the year to go all out and dress up in whatever you never have the excuse to wear otherwise. 

The event will start off with a 30-minute Salsa dance lesson to get you on the dance floor. This is a great opportunity to meet some new people and get comfortable before the open dancing starts! Later in the night there will be a chance to learn Two-Step moves.

Entrance: 

• $15 online till midnight February 12 

• $18 at the door 

Free to those born in February!

The dance party will kickoff around 8 pm after the Salsa lesson. We will play songs from our special V-Day playlist that will include some awesome ballroom and Top 40 dance music.

RESERVE YOUR TICKETS HERE: http://www.meetup.com/Queer-Women-Dance-Night-Out/

Hope to dance with you soon!

results.description:
Join Brynn Bishop and Elizabeth Carrington for a festive Valentine's Celebration exploring authentic connection, sensual delight and divine love.


• Allow your body, heart and soul to be deeply nourished.


• Experience your heart opening more fully to the Beloved within you, and in all of us.


• Share the unique, exquisite essence of who you are.


• Explore authentic connection with yourself and other open-hearted souls through words, breath, sound, movement, energy play and conscious touch.


• Be guided through a series of explorations to re-awaken your sensual pleasure body and savor each of your senses… sight, touch, sound, smell and taste.


• Let your wild innocence play in the sacred playground of pleasure.


• Be honored and adored, just as you are.


• Discover the magic that is possible when you express your desires and stay true to yourself.


In this playful, experiential evening you will practice the following essential intimacy skills:

• Developing awareness of - and asking for - what you truly want in the moment


• Setting boundaries around what you do not want with ease and grace


• Co-creating most pleasurable mutually desired experiences

LIVE Kirtan with guest musicians will support our journey into the heart of devotion.

Discover a new level of playful exploration, wild innocence and exquisite delight!


Come with your partner, bring a friend or come on you own and connect with other singles and couples interested in sacred sexuality, conscious relationship, spirituality.


Leave feeling nurtured, celebrated, expanded and contented, having spent the evening with soulful tribesmates.


Doors open at 7:40pm. DOORS CLOSE AT 8:15pm. We will be creating a sacred container within which to explore safely. Plan to arrive early. If you are not there by 8:15 you will not be permitted to enter.


Fee: $40 by 2/11, $50 thereafter (space permitting). We expect the event to sell out quickly, so get your ticket soon.

Secure your spot by registering here: http://bit.ly/23GWL1h

Your Facilitators:

Brynn Bishop is an Advanced Certified Tantra Educator and Intimacy Coach. Her mission is to empower people to create authentic, loving, pleasurable relationships with themselves and others. She specializes in helping people release sexual shame, reclaim their voice, and awaken their sacred erotic potential. www.conscious-intimacy.com


Elizabeth Carrington is a Master Certified Coach and veteran coach and facilitator.  Her joy is in supporting and empowering people to access their rich inner wisdom, personal power and authentic purpose. www.elizabeth-carrington.com


<a href="http://www.conscious-intimacy.com"></a>
results.name: Tantric Valentine's Celebration: An Evening of Sensual Delight

results.description:
With the 2016 Presidential primaries kicking into high gear, with Donald Trump and Ted Cruz saying crazy things on a nearly daily basis, we need progressive laughs now more than ever. That's why we have Laughing Liberally Boston, a monthly progressive political comedy show featuring some Boston’s top liberal and progressive comedians.

Tickets here:
http://www.theriottheater.com/laughing-liberally-boston.html

Laughing Liberally Boston is hosted by comedian, satirist and progressive talk radio host Matthew Filipowicz. For more information about Matthew, visit http://matthewf.net/

Comedians on the February 13th bill include: Sam Ike, Srilatha Rajamani, Jiayong Li, and Julia Claire.

In addition to some of the finest progressive comedians Boston has to offer, each Laughing Liberally Boston show will feature a special interview segment with a local political figure, journalist or activist. This month’s guest is Lydia Edwards. Lydia is the former director of the Massachusetts Coalition For Domestic Workers, a public interest lawyer for Greater Boston Legal Services, and current candidate for State Senate in Massachusetts.

Laughing Liberally Boston takes place the second Saturday of every month, with the next show on Saturday February 13th at 8pm at the Riot Theater, 146a South Street, Jamaica Plain, MA. Admission is $8.

This and every Saturday night, live from the back room of the The Dugout Cafe (722 Comm Ave), John Baglio, Julia Claire, and Zach "Zack" Armentrout bring you a different lineup stacked with the biggest, baddest, and bestiest comedians from Boston and beyond. And guess what? Its only FIVE DOLLARS! With drink specials as far as the eye can see and free popcorn, this intimate atmosphere is the perfect place to take in some meaningful and quality laughs!

Buy your tix now to guarantee a seat as spaces are limited. We don't want to turn you away again Rocky. RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-15228587114

This week's show features the comedic talents of:

ADAM LANGLOIS (Hot Garbage)

ROHAN PADHYE (San Diego Comedy Festival)

OWEN LINDERS (Thunderbar Comedy)

GARY PETERSEN (album recording at The GAS at Great Scott Feb 26 + 27)

MIKE RECINE (Conan on TBS, album "Union Delegate" available)

AND MORE! DONT MISS THIS SHOW!!!
results.name: The Mendoza Line! $5 Comedy!

results.description:
If you wish to join us, get tickets for Section B - we'll all gather there and eat together.  It will be a smaller group.  Please order your tickets now at www.johnnyds.com   .   Tickets will sell out quickly and I can't guarantee you can join us unless you buy the tickets. 

Booty Vortex hails from Somerville MA and is a 12 piece disco/funk sound explosion. With costumes that will set your wayback machine to the heyday of disco and a booty shaking, mind blowing groove, we defy you to not dance dance dance!

go to Johnny D's and make reservations now - tickets are very limited, as are spaces at our tables. Get reservations for Section B - you must buy at least $15 worth of food. If you don't want to come for dinner, get general admission tickets, but please, get them in advance. This event will sell out. Tickets are $15 ea. 

Guaranteed Seating: For guaranteed seating, purchase a ticket in one of the main room zone B, arrive within designated time which is in your confirmation email, and purchase dinner that evening. $15 FOOD minimum per person plus 7% meal tax
results.name: Dinner and the Booty Vortex at Johnny D's - advanced purchase required

results.description:
You ready to work on some NIGHT MOVES? GET YOUR TICKETS NOW: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/night-moves-tickets-19940104389

Last year, you packed the house to witness what happens when Boston's hugely popular Wild Memory Nation storytelling show (Boston Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Women in Comedy Festival, ImprovBoston SketchHaus) got the late night treatment ... and got a little naughty. Now, on the eve of Valentine's Day, we're back with a new clutch of sexy stories, just for you:

NIGHT MOVES features some of the best comedians telling the funniest stories about the most ticklish subject of all: sex. From sex-positive hilarity to the most intimate of disasters, NIGHT MOVES brings you the saucy side of Boston comedy. With:

Kenice Mobley
Gary Petersen
Jordan Handren-Seavey
Dan Strom
Adam Finne
and Marissa Kennedy

True sex stories, real funny. Only at ImprovBoston!
results.name: Boston's Sexiest Storytelling Show is BACK!

results.description:
Poses begin the first Sunday of the month unless otherwise noted.

Meet to paint the model for a five week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $55, non-members for $70.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $75 or $90 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Vernon and Central streets
results.name: Sunday painting

results.description:
Don't have a special-someone in your life for Valentine's Day? No problem! OutBreath has something even better for you.

South Shore Insight Meditation Center is offering its second annual "Metta Fest." Metta is the meditation technique taught by the Buddha that cultivates loving kindness toward yourself, toward important people in your life, toward difficult people, and toward all living beings. You discover a deeper kind of love, of being interconnected with the divinity of everyone and everything around you. 

The world is rediscovering the 2,500-year-old practice of metta. A growing number of recent clinical studies demonstrate how sustained metta practice increases joy, improves health, and elevates happiness.

SSIMC's Metta Fest includes a few Valentine's Day surprises too. Check it out at: www.ssimc.org
results.name: Second Annual Metta Fest!

results.description:
NOTE: This is a continuation of  the classes started on Sunday, February 7th.


This is a 4 week course. If you RSVP for this date you are RSVPing for the complete 4 week course. Please only RSVP if you are committed to attending to the whole series.


This course introduces students to the basic principles of 3D modeling, such as how to navigate in 3D space, what 3D models are made out of, and how to create simple forms and objects. The software used will be Sketchup, a free program that is excellent for beginners and professionals alike. Students will learn the ins and outs of the program, from basic techniques to advanced modeling concepts. This series is for people who have not already taken a 3D modeling class at HATCH.


Requirements:


• A free copy of Sketchup. 

• A CAD-capable laptop or desktop. The computer must have a discrete graphics chip or a very new (last three years) onboard graphics chip.


• A three button (minimum) mouse.


• You must be an experienced Windows or Mac user.


• You should be able to utilize keyboard shortcuts and understand how to use computer file systems.


*If you need a laptop please contact the organizer, we have six laptops available for use. We prefer that you use your own for this class.*

If you are bringing your own computer, please pre-load Sketchup Make. You can download it from <a>www.sketchup.com.</a>
results.how_to_find_us: We're located in the Arsenal Project (formerly Arsenal Mall). Park in the lot near Old Navy entrance, you'll see a big yellow-green sign over the doors. HATCH is between Pearle Vision and Game Stop.
results.name: Introduction to 3D Modeling (4 week class)

results.description:
It's winter time and colder now, so let's stay active indoors. We have beginner & intermediate levels of players. Please read the notes below about rackets & sneakers.


Lunch (optional) will be at Mulan @ 835 Main St. Waltham.


http://taohaidongttc.webs.com/

Entry fee: $15/person for badminton and ping pong.

They have both badminton nets and ping pong tables. You are welcome to play one or both that day.

There are three badminton courts which is why we have to limit the amount of RSVPs. And it's open gym so other non-meetup members may be there as well.

Racket - They DO NOT rent equip so you will NEED TO bring your own rackets. Some of us have an extra racket you can borrow.

SNEAKERS (the bottom of your sneakers cannot be black or dark colored)!!! They are strict and you will be asked off the courts. The owner doesn't want to mark up his courts.
results.name: Badminton and Ping Pong & Lunch

results.description:
We will be working through Meyer text on the Dussack.  We will also look at how these techniques apply to  One-handed or arming sword.

We are going to interpret Joachim Meyer’s Dussak.  The translation we will use is in

The Art of Combat: A German Martial Arts Treatise of 1570 (Hardcover)

http://www.amazon.com/gp/offer-listing/1848327781/ref=sr_1_5_twi_2_har_olp?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1434813702&sr=1-5&keywords=meyer

with additional material from Meyer’s 1560 work

https://sites.google.com/site/jochimmeyer1560/home/Meyer_1560_english_Maurer_2012.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bxqzt-jcOCFsT19Xa1Q2QXltWm8/edit

Finally some from

Cod.Guelf.83.4 Aug.8º


http://www.thearma.org/Manuals/Codex-Guelf-83.4-Aug-8f-translation.pdf
results.name: Dussack, One-handed sword, Interpreting Meyer Dussack

results.description: Join our experts for an exciting hike in the wilderness of Estabrook Woods, the largest contiguous and undeveloped woodland within 30 miles of Boston. Located just two miles north of Concord, this wild tract of land has more than 1,200 acres of woods, hills, ledges and wetlands and offers an extensive network of trails to explore. We'll take you on some of our favorite trails where you'll have a chance to see the abundant wildlife that inhabits this area. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing; waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton). Please bring a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need.  Ages 8 and up are welcome.  Hope to see you on the trail!
results.how_to_find_us: Park on the same side of the road that the entrance is on.  There is no parking allowed on the other side of the road.  Please be aware.  They will ticket if you park on the other side of the road.
results.name: Hike Estabrook Woods

results.description:
2/2/2015 - Update 

I changed the start time from 10:15 am to 10 am.  Because on the Chinese New Year, they are not taking reservations.  So seating will be on a first come, first serve basis.  To avoid the chaos, we need to meet before the crowds begin and this little extra time will make a great difference.  Thank you. 

Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


Lets celebrate the new Chinese New Year 4713, the year of the Monkey, eating Dim Sum at Chinatown's Hei La Moon, http://www.heilamoon.com/ .  

It happens that this year's Boston Chinatown new year festivities fall on Valentines Day.  So, Happy Valentines Day!  On this day, Chinatown will also be hosting the lion parades.  After Dim Sum, we can check out the parades and street festivities.  

I have been hosting Chinese New Year dim sum events for several year.  This is such an enjoyable event if we all arrive on time.  

The meeting time for this event is 10:00 am sharp!  

The Chinese New Year is Chinatown's most celebrated holiday.  The parades start at 11 am, this is when the crowds begins.  I purposely chose 10:00 am as our starting time as to avoid the crowds.  Speaking from experience, it is near impossible to congregate as a group once the crowds begin.  

Please plan ahead and expect delays in traffic, parking, and public transportation delays. Please give yourself extra time to travel to this event so you can arrive on-time at Hei La Moon Restaurant.  

***There is a validated parking garage right above the restaurant.  If you are driving, please allow yourself extra time.  ***

If you are late, I can not guarantee that you will be able to join the group. It will be crowded and you may not recognize us and we may not recognize you in the crowds.

In order for this event to be successful, we will need to be organized and follow some rules.

Rule number 1 - Please show-up if you reserved "yes"

I will be sending reminder emails asking you to reconfirm your reservations. I will be putting special efforts in reconfirming everyone's attendance the week prior to the event.  If you do not reconfirm your attendance, I will assume that you are no longer coming and therefore remove you from the attendance roster and give your space to the next person who confirms attendance from the waiting list.

Rule Number 2 - Be on time!

For this activity is group food sharing activity, it very important that you be on time for we all need to be at the same time and place to share our meal.

Please plan ahead and allow yourself extra time to travel or park in Chinatown. I strongly recommend that you travel by pubic transportation, the T (subway). The nearest T stops are Orange Line, Chinatown and Red Line, South Stations. 

When we have a large group, please understand that it is not fair to ask those who have arrived early to wait for late comers.  Most importantly, it is not fair for the restaurant to hold empty seats and lose business for latecomers or for people who fail to show-up.  If you are late, please understand that we can not wait for you and can not guarantee that you will be able to join the group.

Rule Number 3 - Please be financially prepared to pay for your meal including taxes and tip.

Meal sales tax is 6.25% and group tip is at least 18%.  Total your portion of the bill and add 24.25%, round it up to 25%.

The exact price will depend on what exactly is ordered and the number of people in the group. The price could range from $8 to $15 per person including tip.

This should be a super enjoyabe event.  I look forward to enjoying this festival with the group.


Joana

***************************************************

Additional Information about Dim Sum & Chinatown New Year Festivities

*****************************************************

For those who never had Dim Sum, Dim Sum offers a menu of a variety of bite-size food and dumplings. The fun is in ordering as a group and in sharing Dim Sum orders. The result, the group gets to sample all sorts of delicious and some exotic food items.  The best part is the price, the bill has always seemed surprisingly low at the end of the meal especially considering all the food that was enjoyed.  


http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dim_sum


http://chinesefood.about.com/od/diningout/p/dim_sum.htm

http://www.boston-discovery-guide.com/chinese-new-year-parade.html

http://chinatown-directory.com/celebrations/

To find out if you are a monkey, check out your Chinese horoscope at http://www.horoscope.com/us/horoscopes/chinese/index-horoscope-chinese.aspx .
results.how_to_find_us: at the entrance at 10:00 am sharp!
results.name: DIM SUM at Hei La Moon!  Happy Chinese New Year 4713! Year of Monkey!

results.description:
Greater Boston Oasis meets every week for engaging speakers, live musicians, and the opportunity to connect with the community. Details of the speakers, musical guests, etc. will be posted in the individual meetups as they are confirmed.

Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!

=========================================


This Valentine's Day, we're hosting a panel of Oasis members and others to talk about forms relationships can take that you don't usually find cards for in the Hallmark store this time of year. LGBT, polyamorous, asexual/aromantic, queerplatonic, kinky, child-free, and others, this is a chance to talk about all the ways connection between partners manifests itself. We expect and hope this will be a lively and informative discussion, and we hope some of our attendees will come to share their own experiences!

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs


Reality is known through reason


Meaning comes from making a difference


Human hands solve human problems


Be accepting, and be accepted

results.description:
Our services have three parts: Healing Service, a Lecture on a spiritual topic, and Mediumship Spirit Communication. Each part lasts approximately 30 minutes.

The Healing Service gives you the opportunity to receive healing energy that is channeled through one of our Healers. We believe that healing can be channeled through thought to those who need it. This is a very calming experience, whether or not you choose to sit in a healing chair.  We encourage you to send healing to your loved ones, our communities, and Mother Earth.

The Lecture covers a variety of topics ranging from the History of Spiritualism to Inspired Insights. It also includes examples of how Spiritualism is a part of our lives on a daily basis.

Mediumship, or Spirit Communication, is the part of the service where a medium proves that "...the existence and personal identity of the individual continue after the change called death." The medium might be a member of our church or visiting from another the Spiritualist church in the community. We also have mediums from abroad stop in often. While there is only enough time during a service for a few people to receive messages from their deceased loved ones on the Higher side Side of Life, everyone present benefits by witnessing proof of the continuation of life.

At the conclusion of the service everyone is invited to our social hour downstairs for coffee and conversation.﻿

results.description:
GUNG HEI FAT CHOI!


which translates to

HAPPY NEW YEAR!

It's the Year the Monkey!

February 8th is the start of the Lunar New Year with two weeks of celebration.

Join our exploration into what is considered the most important festival in Asian culture.

Bring cash, a camera and your sense of adventure as well as wear comfortable footwear and warm clothes.

Along the street there may be some brave vendors selling food and trinkets.

Catch up with us when you can at any of the locations and times

ACTIVITIES:

11:00 AM is when we'll meet at Hei La Moon for dim sum which is a very affordable and delicious dining experience. It's family dining which means sharing. We select food from carts that are wheeled to our table. The price range for each person is from $10 to $15. You can also order separately from a menu...safe but not as adventurous.

A traditional Chinese New Year menu features a la carte dishes such as xiao long bao (traditional dumplings with broth inside); long life noodles with char siu pork, and hot-and-sour whole crispy fish.

12:30 PM leave Hei La Moon


Below are a few post dim sum activities:

1) Walking around Chinatown eating pastries from shops along the way.

2) Warm up inside the China Trade Center 2 Boylston Street to check out the Open House to Chinese Culture (hours 12:00 until 3:00) with activities such as Clay Dough Modeling, origami, Chinese Calligraphy, take your picture with the the "Money God"

3) Ice skating on the Frog Pond in the Boston Common. Cost: $6 for Admission $12 for Rentals $3 for Locker.

4) Check out a movie at AMC Loews - Boston Commons 19 movie schedule (175 Tremont Street)

If you you need more details, have suggestions or need to find us that day, you may call or text me on my cell [masked] or email me at [masked]

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:

Create your own train and/or bus route here MBTA or Hop Stop

Subway Stations are South Station (red line) and Chinatown (orange line) and Boylston (green line)

PARKING will be very difficult, strongly suggest using the MBTA:

Parking Garage above Hei La Moon. If you're facing the restaurant the garage entrance is on the left side of the restaurant.

Stanhope Garage lot[masked]* 33 Essex Street (entrance corner of Essex St and Harrison St) $22 cash

INTERPARK Shoppers Garage[masked] * 40 Beach St $10 cash

Hyatt Regency Hotel Parking (Pilgrim Lafayette Garage) (617)[masked] * 1 Av de Lafayette bet Chauncy St and Washington St) $14 credit card or cash (take your ticket to get validation stamp from Macy's gift wrap in basement for $4 discount pay cashier before you return to your vehicle)

AFTER YOU RSVP PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE ANSWER THE QUESTIONS BECAUSE IT LET'S US KNOW WHEN YOU WILL ARRIVE AND PROVIDES AN ACCURATE RESERVATION

Get in

...a 3-week series with Sharon Day, co-director of your Boston OM Center. During this eight-person coaching circle (kept small so you get personal attention) learn from a woman who’s willing to reveal everything, giving you the ins and outs of how to untangle your self-limiting wiring and expand your capacity for having much, much more. Includes instruction on how to map the principles of Orgasmic Meditation (OM) onto your relationships, your sex, and your life, and personalized assignments (the fun kind). 

Sharon brings her nearly two decades of professional coaching along with her recent two years of deep immersion in Orgasmic Meditation. She connects with you swiftly and deeply, illuminating hidden obstacles, revealing your brilliance, and waking you up. 

Immerse

…in a rich discussion on the things that can usually only be whispered about, freeing your sex and desire, awakening powerful parts of yourself, and integrating your revelations into your life through exercises and practices. You can let yourself come out, sink in and get saturated with orgasm, and rediscover your innate capacity to transmute problems into fuel.

Get out

…and take what you’ve learned into your life and the world. Become the man or woman you yearn to be in relationships. Have more confidence in sex, work, and in life. Remember who you are at a core level and play with living your life from that empowered place.

results.description:
With Darwin Day on Feb 12, and Valentine's Day on Feb 14, the Humanist Hub invites you to a conversation about love: the good, the bad, the biological, and the existential.

Modern romantic ideals about finding the one and living happily ever are being brought into question by websites that encourage infidelity, wider legal and social acceptance of relationship variations, and the fact that almost one in two marriages don't make it to their 30 year pearl anniversary. 

Drawing on the existential philosophers and lovers Simone de Beauvoir and Jean-Paul Sartre, including Sartre's famous lecture ‘Existentialism is a Humanism’, this talk will explore the role of loyalty, commitment, monogamy, and honesty in humanism and humanist values. Are these, de facto, things that are aligned with humanism? Should they be? What role does communication play?

Skye Cleary,(PhD, MBA) is a philosopher and author of "Existentialism and Romantic Love," and writer for The Huffington Post, ABC Radio National, YourTango, Aeon Ideas, Actualise Daily and others.

Following the talk we envite you to enjoy some Darwin Day-themed activities and refreshments!
results.name: Skye Cleary: Existentialism, Evolution & Romantic Love

group.name: The Humanist Hub in Harvard Square

results.description:
Hi All, 

Let's sketch Trinity Church! As a forewarning, Trinity Church is not free, the price will be $7 for an adult, $5 with a student ID, $5 for seniors. Go to the bookstore to purchase an entry ticket.

Trinity Church was built in 1877 after the Great Boston Fire burned the original structure. The Trinity Church congregation was founded in 1733.

 Sitting in Copley Square, the church and parish house were designed by Henry Richardson and construction took place from 1872 to 1877, when the complex was consecrated. It established Richardson's career, and even became it's own architectural form, the Richardsonian Romanesque style, characterized by a clay roof, polychromy, rough stone, heavy arches, and a massive tower. This style was soon adopted for a number of public buildings across the United States.

With murals covering 21500 square feet, and stained glass in the interior, let's sketch this building that has been named in the top 10 most significant buildings in the U.S. Hope to see you all there!

- Miriam

results.description:
The “Monastic Cooking Club” in conjunction with our Business Sponsor, the Civic Friary®, is hosting a Catholic Film Fest,

                   FOCUS OF FAITH IN MOVIES & FILM 

starting with:


                               Babette’s Feast

Although theAbstract by Wendy Wright in the Journal of Religion and Film seems to intelligently depict the cinematically themed dynamic of religion, the focus of this Film Fest is “Faith” and that focus takes on a considerably different (albeit not necessarily incompatible) angle of appreciation.

The film Babette’s Feast is a truly remarkable work of art, indeed a love story. “Love” is depicted in the true Saintly tradition of Valentine’s Day, appropriately for when this first movie of our Film Fest is scheduled for viewing. 

While watching the movie, we recommend an attentiveness to the film's subtle background of silence and solitude while fully appreciating how the unfolding story helps spawn insights that will indeed stir one’s soul and generate a prayerful appreciation of Faith at work though love and service. Slowly, and peacefully, that love and service indicate that by following the path God lays before her (or any of us in real life), Babette carries her cross without trying to make it any lighter or any heavier.

Babette’s yielding to a solid Peace offered in Christian Faith universally to all at all times and in unity with Jesus the Christ her Risen Savior, makes this “main character” of the film show that the real Main Character in life is the Holy Presence of God.

Alleluias are not a typical Lenten form of expression, in the liturgical sense of anticipatory preparedness for the longer Season of Easter (Lent is 40 days and Easter is over fifty days!). But there is no Resurrection without the Cross. The very beautiful Cross given to us by God, therefore, will have us even in Lent proclaiming “Alleluia” as this film partakes in the sweet sufferings we endure through unity in Christ with the Hope of fulfillment in the making.

Dinner & a Movie! Can't go wrong there--we'll spend a few short minutes on Evening Prayer as Grace before the Meal, which can be found your Smart Phone at: 

  http://www.divineoffice.org/lent-w01-sun-ep2/?date=201602/14

Bring only your love to this event (and/or any donations of food, etc.), as it is indeed a FREE EVENT!


CALL 781-C-FRIARS for more information, questions, etc.
results.name: FOCUS OF FAITH IN MOVIES & FILM

results.description:
For the 10th consecutive year, the ICA presents the Oscar-nominated shorts program featuring an intriguing array of the live-action, animated, and documentary films you always wish you’d had an opportunity to see come Oscar night (Feb 28).

</a><a href="https://www.icaboston.org/video/film2016-oscar-nominated-short-films-trailer">FILM_2016 OSCAR NOMINATED SHORT FILMS TRAILER


https://www.icaboston.org/sites/default/files/styles/teaser_list_1_video/public/vimeo-146928939.jpg?itok=F_ubNfQP

Sun Feb 14, 2 PM | Live Action Shorts ADVANCED TICKETS


Sun Feb 14, 4:30 PM | Animation Shorts - ADVANCED TICKETS


Suffering, embattled nobility and a dash of whimsy. Those emotional currents define this year’s Oscar-nominated short films, with pain and strife dominating.

Despite the paucity of humor, there is just enough levity in the three-part program of films competing for Academy Awards in the live-action, animation and documentary categories to prevent viewers from succumbing to despair. The heavy stuff is especially concentrated in documentary shorts made for HBO that deal with the Ebola virus, a Pakistani honor killing and the Holocaust. All together, the 15 shorts  demonstrate a level of quality and technical ingenuity comparable to that of the Oscar-nominated feature-length films.

Girl in the River won the Pho Oscar in the Documentary Category, and Shock won the Friendly Oscar in the Live Action Category in previous Meetups. 

We will be adding our votes for the ICA Oscars in both the Live Action and the Animated Category.  Come Oscar Night, we will be familiar with the nominees in all three categories. 

See you at the Oscar Nominated best short films from around the world, 2015!

John

results.description:
Here's the link to the online location:

http://www.gratefulness.org/labyrinth/index.htm

Hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

Remember that in the labyrinth the 3D rules relax. Time, space, extraneous noise and interruption are altered as we move toward center. This creates a personal, sacred space, a high frequency bubble of awareness that allows your stress to be transformed by the laws of resonance.

   This interactive model gives you multiple options. You  may use your mouse to move the cursor or you may choose to allow the program to do that for you. Either way, you may follow the mouse with your eyes or a finger. Close or cover one eye... and follow with the other:  you access & enhance the opposite side of your brain. Do the same with the other, then perhaps, both. If you are using your finger to follow the cursor along the path use one finger the first time... use the same finger on the other hand next time. Again, this accesses different parts of your brain and brings clearing & energy to that part that is being stimulated. This translates into clearer neurological pathways, clearer energy meridians in your body and opportunities for greater insight, stronger connections to your own intuition and spirit.

  Before your 'walk, you could smudge, light a candle, say a prayer, call in the Four Directions, invite your angels or guides to be present with you on the path.... Set your intention if you wish, ask your guidance to show you what you need to know, or what is standing in your way. You might ask  to understand and  release an illusion that is keeping you from a relationship or abundance in your life.

   As you return from center, you may invite understanding, knowing, peace to fill your awareness. 

   Take time for yourself after your 'walk'. Have some water handy. This kind of vibrational/energy work allows the body to transmute and release long held concepts, belief forms, illusions from their resting place in cellular memory to be transformed into energy that supports you instead of weighing you down. Just as if you did yoga or had a massage, your body may release and clear pure water will support the process.

   Even in an interactive online labyrinth... you are never alone... If we all walk at 3 on the 2nd Sunday... we walk together. And always, even when it seems we are walking alone, or not...  our guides & angels are there.

   Will be posting a couple of holiday events... hope to see you in 3D soon. Peace, Deb

Chateau de Beaucastel Masters Chateauneuf-du-Pape's Thirteeen Varietals

It doesn't get any better than this for me -- Beaucastel is my favorite red wine period! I was first introduced to their amazing 1978 vintage while living in Paris eons ago and have had many superb examples since then. In 2014, I arranged for a private tasting at their family estate in the Rhone valley during our France food and wine tour.

In this tasting we will be doing a vertical flight of several vintages:

• 1998 (killer!)

• 2001

• 2012

• 2013

This will be a rare treat. 

Price is $60 payable to Boston Wine Expo (click here for ticketing)

Note, RSVPing here does NOT sign you up for this Boston Wine Expo seminar. You MUST reserve your spot by paying via the Expo web side. Click above to pay.

I haven't set a limit on RSVPs, but be aware that these seminars are selling out fast, so you should book quickly to ensure a spot.

This event is part of a series of BostonWine events focused on the Wine Expo Seminars Series. 

About the Seminar

If you are fan of Rhone wines, you have undoubtedly heard of Chateau de Beaucastel, one of the best known and most highly regarded producers of Chateauneuf-du-Pape. This internationally admired estate has been capably run by the Perrin family over the decades. We are more than a little proud to welcome Emmanuel Lemoine, who has worked with the Famille Perrin wines for some time. He will provide a bit of history and a lot of what distinguishes these terrific red wines.

In this seminar you will taste outstanding Beaucastel Chateauneuf-du-Papes from three decades: 1998, 2001 and 2012. Both the 2001 and 2012 wines received 96 points from Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate, who said of the 2012 'What I think might end up being the best Beaucastel since the 1990 or 2001, the 2012 Châteauneuf du Pape offers a full-bodied, decadent style to go with awesome black and blue fruits, garrigue, licorice, crushed flowers and violets. The purity here is truly something?' 

Attendees will also be among the first to taste the 2013 Chateauneuf prior to release, along with the current releases of the Perrin's Gigondas, Vacqueyras, and Vinsorbes. 

Not to be missed!

Location: Harborview 3

Speakers: Emmanuel Lemoine

About Boston Wine Expo

Boston Wine Expo happens every year and currently comprises an entire week of festivities celebrating wine, food and culture from the greatest wine-growing regions of the world.

• A weeklong series of events

• Outstanding cuisine from more than 40 restaurants

• Expanded education series

• Nightly vintner dinners at top restaurants

• VIP and Grand Cru Wine Lounge, barrel samplings and vertical tastings

Get more details here:

http://www.wine-expos.com/page.cfm/Link=1/t=m/goSection=1


There is a huge--as in thousands of people--Grand tasting Sat. and Sunday, and a VIP tasting as well, which is fairly expensive. The Seminar Series is the best value for dollar in my experience and often a tremendous experience.  

Boston Wine Expo 2014

Seaport World Trade Center and Seaport Hotel
200 Seaport Boulevard
Boston, MA 02210
(877)[masked]
Metro: Silver Line Waterfront (SL1)

Parking is available ($$$) at the Seaport Hotel or in lots surrounding the area.

Look forward to seeing you there!

-jim

venue.address_1: Porter Square Shopping Center, White Street, Cambridge, MA
venue.name: Panera Bread - Downstairs

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Panera Bread in Porter Square Shopping Center

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Panera Bread is right next to Dunkin Donuts. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
The oldest, established, permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and environs.

Please join the Fresh Pond Community walkers + five other meetup groups for this delightful sunset walk. 

Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 3 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 2/14 4:00

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.
results.name: The Salem MA Weekly Meditation Group
