results.description:
FIRST COME FIRST SEATED at the reserved area, if you're-- say-- 10 minutes late, seating nearby is up to you or you can just stand around, mingle, and chat.

Please bring cash and pay as you go!  Tip well, the wait staff here is about as good as it gets.

Please Mix & Mingle, don't get glued to your seats. Gents: please wear and wax your finest mustaches. Sideburns encouraged. Goatees (hairy faces) OK. 

You don't have to be a genuine intellectual-- pseudo-intellectuals are also welcome.

All you need is an aloof attitude full of irony or some baffling ideas, or-- dare I say it-- some unanswered  metaphysical question you never figured out that you want answered incognito. This forum is designed so you don't have to reveal you are actually seeking an answer. 

What constitutes success? Money? Love? Power? & what's most important to succeed? Persistence? Cunning? Creativity?

Interestingly, most advice people give each other is about how to succeed (or how to not fail). Gather your rosebuds while ye may; a stitch in time saves nine, waste not want not, knock & ye shall enter, where there's a will there's a way, carpe diem (seize the day), look before you leap, etc.

Here's something from Woody Allen, on "How to Succeed at Anything"--

"The less you can think about yourself, the better. 
It's like being a baseball pitcher; the less you're conscious of your motion the better you pitch.  Just do good work, don't waste time thinking about anything else, ...don't pay attention to the distractions that people send your way, and everything will fall into place." ...actor Will Smith: "Don't chase people. Just do good work and the right people will come to you".

Now here are some expert advice examples from authorities of ancient times: on succeeding--

"Greatness is dealing only with matters of great consequence";
"Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power"
I think these quotes are from Seneca. On failure:

"He who is not master over himself is bound to live in slavery"
(Marcus Aurelius [?])
"The gormandizing that allures the servile crowd is a trap to free men" (Spartans--quoted in Plutarch[?]).     


Above: "Gather ye Rosebuds While ye May," (1909).   

Humor in good taste-- ALLOWED. Startle the waitstaff with a goatee, Periwig, or monocle. Fold-up sunglasses, corduroy jackets with elbow patches-- ALLOWED. No Meerschaum tobacco pipes, please. Absinthe is not served.
results.how_to_find_us: Special reserved "tall tables" just behind Reception.
results.name: Intellectual Snob Meetup "BEST OF": How do you Measure Success?

results.description:
Tired of online dating? Have room for more love in your life? Ready to meet great like-minded progressives? Then you'll want to join us for our annual Dating While Progressive event, a fun and welcoming singles party!*

RSVP at www.SoJust.org - newcomers always welcomed.

This Socializing for Justice event is co-hosted by several progressive organizations, including Bisexual Resource Center, Boston Queer Polyamorous Women's Group, City Awake, Future Boston Alliance, New Leaders Council - Boston, and One Brick Boston.


Haven't been to a Socializing for Justice event? It’s time to meet the friendly faces of the group that’s grown to over 2800 members, hosted over 210 events and fostered hundreds of connections since our founding 9+ years ago. 

Cost: $10-$20 collected at the door. Every $10 receives a raffle ticket to win the door prize. Also, use your raffle ticket to vote on which domestic violence support organization receives 25% of proceeds.

A great spread of complimentary appetizers will be provided.

THIS IS NOT A MEETING - IT'S A FUN SINGLES PARTY! 
No Program. No Speaker. (No Speed Dating.) Just Us. For Justice.

YES, WE MEAN YOU. Anyone who's single and/or available is invited! Attendees are all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism and professions. Some just moved to Boston and others were born here. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.

As always we'll help you mix and mingle - so no worries if you're new to SoJust, plus we'll have "I'M LOOKING FOR", "ASK ME ABOUT" tags and a flirty bingo ice-breaker. Join us if you are ready to go BEYOND FRIENDS - movements are built on RELATIONSHIPS!

HELP SPREAD THE WORD! 
Invite your friends to this Facebook event.
Join the SoJust Facebook group: http://on.fb.me/SoJust
On Twitter? Follow @SoJust and SoJust's Founder @RobbieSamuels #sojust

SOCIALIZING FOR JUSTICE - www.sojust.org
SoJust is all about building a cross-issue progressive community, network and movement in Boston. We're doing it by putting the SOCIAL back in SOCIAL JUSTICE. We focus on creating welcoming spaces that foster relationship-building across issue silos.

*The venue is open to anyone over 18 (must be 21+ to enter after 7PM) and is partially physically accessible - elevator is at the back of the main floor of the venue and bathrooms are big enough for manual, but not motor-powered, wheelchairs. Lir is across from the Hynes Convention Center. Parking near Lir can be difficult - you could get lucky or you could drive around for 30 or more minutes. There are parking garages by Back Bay station. Best bet is to take the T to Back Bay or Hynes Convention Center (which is the closest T stop).
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be downstairs.
results.name: Dating While Progressive (@SoJust Singles Party)

results.description:
Valentines Day and eating chocolate. Just add mindfulness meditation!

Gena Bean will be leading this Eating Meditation.   Our event start time is 6:00pm.  But please arrive early to settle in.  

Our schedule:
5:45pm -  It's great to arrive early to ask questions and find a good seat.  We have chitchat time starting around 5:45. This is the YMCA location, so you will need to sign in.
6:00pm - Class starts.
Please note: We lock the door by 6:30pm.  At 6:30pm, you would already be 30 minutes late for class, so please do not disturb the class by trying to enter or knocking. 
7:15pm - Class ends.

What happens during class: 
   The 75 minutes that we spend together will include: 
            1) discussion about meditation and mindfulness and how it relates to eating in general, in addition to specifics about chocolate. 
           {Fair Trade chocolate is included as part of the class}
            2) instructions on how to meditate 
            3) an experience of eating chocolate in a mindful way

The length of the Mindful Eating meditation itself will probably be about 30 minutes long. We will eat 2 or 3 kinds of chocolate.  
No previous experience is required; the meditation will be easy for beginners to understand.


What to bring: 

It's fine to just show up as you are.   

We will be drinking water between eating. So you can bring a water bottle. But paper cups will be provided, so it is not required.

There will be enough chairs for every person.  

There are also meditation cushions for those who prefer to be seated on the floor. 

Valentine's dates, or not-dates:  

• It's great for single chocolate lovers to come on their own. 
• It's great for any couple to come together, if you are in a couple.  
• Friendship "couples" are also welcome. 
• A pair of people must buy two tickets. 

• Each ticket costs $20 per person and includes chocolate.
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in at the YMCA front desk.
results.name: Eating Chocolate Mindfully - A Meditation Class

results.description:
Well, for many Valentine's Day is THE most romantic day of the year....for others, it's just a Hallmark occasion....and for others, it's well...you know...

So, for those of us who are either unattached romantically at the moment, or who are without their loved one for some reason on V-Day, let's get together for drinks & dinner and talk about...what else? LOVE....That 4 letter word!!!

What does 'true love' mean to you? How many times have you fallen in love..truly, deeply? Do you believe that love that can happen at any age? (I do!)....so, for all the times we've talked about 'other ' kinds of love (Family, parent/child, friends, etc)...tonight is dedicated to the idea of romantic love...how does it begin? Grow? How is the romance sustained? Why do we 'need' a day to remind people to tell the people they love that they love them?? I think it's purely commercial ...(yeah, bah humbug!)....but then again, if I'm getting candy and/or flowers, I'm getting them for myself ...LOL :)

Hope to spend a 'love-ly' Valentine's Day dinner at the one place I can think of whose prices don't change on V Day and where we can just hang out as solo-togethers.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for Beverly's Table
results.name: Treat Ourselves with Love on Valentine's Day!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 25-37- SOLD OUT FOR MEN

Ben the Event Host is back for another outstanding, high quality, free of charge event coming your way—

War Room Movie Description: With great jobs, a beautiful daughter (Alena Pitts) and a dream house, the Jordans seem to have it all. Appearances can be deceiving, however, as husband Tony (T.C. Stallings) flirts with temptation and wife Elizabeth (Priscilla Shirer) becomes increasingly bitter, crumbling under the strain of a failing marriage. Their lives take an unexpected turn for the better when Elizabeth meets her newest client, Miss Clara (Karen Abercrombie), who encourages the couple to find happiness through prayer.

For more info, check out Calvary Christian Church's website:
http://www.lynnfield-ccc.org
results.name: Christian Movie, War Room, on the Big Screen

results.description:
{With "sweetheart" defined broadly, we'll look at our little every day loves and spend a little time looking at our larger loves.  We'll remember past loves, share current loves, and look forward to future loves.  Like any party, we'll chat and eat, and we'll appreciate one another, and, like any HeartBeat Salon, we'll bring consciousness to where we have been and to where we are going.}

This Evening We Will ....

... honor all the sweethearts we have (and have had) in our lives.  We'll celebrate the great aspects of all great people who fill our hearts.  We'll remember past great loves, as well as the little loves that sustain us throughout our lives. We'll recognize the loves we have today -- our friends and partners.  And we'll look forward to making our future loves even more nurturing.

And we'll look at ourselves -- what brought out the best in us, and what more we can bring to our relationships.

We'll honor the beauty we see in one another, as well as the reflection of our own beauty.

We'll leave this party appreciating our life filled with love, and ready to expand that love all around us.

To Bring ...

This is a potluck dinner party, so bring something easy, and tasty, to eat.  (If you do not like to prepare or buy food, throw $10 per person in the pot.) 

[Optional]: Bring a friend who is a sweetheart!

To Prepare ....

1)  Who were your past "great loves"?  What did you love about them?  What did you love about yourself when you were with them?
2) Who were the "little loves" in your past?  The friends, mentors, guides?  What parts of yourself did they sustain, nurture, and propel?
3) Who are your loves today -- partners and friends?  What is it in them that you love?  What is it in you that you love seeing reflected? 
3) What love do you want to create for yourself this year?   What quality can you give more of?  What is most important for you to receive in return?  How can you create that love?

Our Leader This Evening

This is a Route 128 South Heartbeat Salon community event.  All of us will share our year that was and start to create our year that will be.

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies: 
  *  What is a Heartbeat Salon?  
  *  Where are Heartbeat Salons  
  *  Guidelines for Attending a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Hosts: 
  * How to Host a Heartbeat Salon . 
  * Topics to Offer at a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Presenters: 
  * How to Present at a Heartbeat Salon .

Your Suggestions: 
  * Give Us Your Ideas (topics, locations, etc) . 

9/03/15
results.name: HBS-128S: Who Are Your Sweethearts? (Valentine potluck party)

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This Sunday’s regularly scheduled “LGBT Meditation Group" program has been cancelled. HOWEVER, The LGBT Meditation Group and the Shambhala Meditation Center of Boston are co-sponsoring a special alternative Valentine's Day program!

The Four Noble Truths of Love
with Susan Piver

BRING A FRIEND FOR FREE
Register and add your friend’s name in the comment box.

http://boston.shambhala.org/registration/?action=form&id=258244

PRICE
$25 Patron
$18 Sustaining
Generosity Policy pricing is available (see details on this page: http://boston.shambhala.org/pricing-policy/)

PROGRAM DESCRIPTION
Love is all that matters. No, wait. Love stinks. Which one?! It is not always easy to tell. 

Nothing rouses as much joy and chaos as romantic love. No matter how committed you are to being level-headed and rational, when love strikes or departs, all bets are off. This, as it turns out, is fantastic news: When all of your strategies are blown, there is an opportunity to deepen your understanding of what it really means to love-which makes you more awesome at giving love, receiving it, and surviving its absence.

Join us for an evening conversation about the realities of love. 

The program will include meditation (instruction will be given), a talk from Susan, and one-to-one discussion with a random partner. 

Instead of kittens with balloons and heart-shaped candies, let's celebrate the truth of love as a path of fierce warriorship. Okay, and maybe we could have some heart-shaped candies too.

Bring your sweetie, a friend or come solo! 

Sun. Feb. 14th
6-8pm Program with Susan Piver
8pm Valentine's Party

Shambhala Meditation Center of Boston
646 Brookline Avenue
Brookline, MA
results.name: LGBT Meditation Group

results.description:
Scenergy Dating is bringing a bit of mystery, anticipation, and excitement into your dating life with our signature "Mystery Cards" icebreaker. You may have heard of Speed Dating events but Scenergy Dating is unlike anything you've experienced. For starters, we emphasize a "dress to impress" atmosphere where professional singles of all backgrounds are welcome to mix and mingle under one roof. Our professional staff understands the jitters that come with attending a singles event and they do a great job at calming your nerves and welcoming you in.

Once you enter, instead of spending time texting friends, you will be encouraged to make new connections while also enjoying our signature icebreaker in a trendy environment hand selected by your coordinator.


WHAT MAKES SCENERGY DIFFERENT:

- We're a full dating solution that also provides personal matchmaking, online dating, and a variety of events.
- Our events are "Shaken not Stirred"!
- Event Coordinators not only check you in but are actively engaged in ensuring you have a good time and feel safe.
- We host seminars, dance lessons, dating workshops, and many types of icebreakers to keep you entertained.


HOW "MYSTERY SINGLES" WORKS:

- Singles will receive an index card
- They will fill out information according to the coordinator's instructions
- Coordinator will then pass around the cards
- Attendees will be encouraged to find their "Mystery Single", while also mixing & mingling
- The more you play the more chances you have in winning grand prizes!


WHAT TO DO/NOT TO DO:

- DO get your money's worth and approach as many singles as you can!
- DO bring your friends but DO NOT stay in your comfort zone!
- DO focus on socializing and making new friends DO NOT just focus on looks!

ENTRANCE FEE:


* Limited to the first 20 men and 20 women so it's important to pre-pay. In order to have a close number of men and women we will sell tickets in increments of 10, when both genders are sold out we will release more tickets accordingly.
- $25 at the door
- $15 pre-paid by RSVP by CLICKING HERE<a href="http://www.scenergy-dating.com"></a>
- $15 at the door "Tag Along Special" (Bring a friend and both save $5)

PERKS:

- Huge drink specials for Scenergy attendees only.


RAFFLE PRIZES:

- FREE passes to future Scenergy Dating events, cash prizes, and so much more!

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked] 


=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to two of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Monroe and Washington. We will use the steep Ammonoosuc Ravine Trail to get to Monroe and then Crawford Path to get to Washington. We will use Gulfside Trail and Jewell Trail to return to the trailhead. The AMC's Lake of the Clouds hut and the Mount Washington Observatory are closed for the season.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 9.5 miles and climb about 4,400 feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours to complete. This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/1-Mt-Washington-6288

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/4-Mt-Monroe-5384

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lon=-71.30365675019486&lat=44.27038780496076#.VjjteITO5_Y 


=== What to Bring ===


Don't wear ANY cotton - this includes your socks and underwear. You will need winter hiking boots - if you wear them in the summer they aren't designed for winter use (e.g. insulation). You will need mountaineering snow shoes. Not all snowshoes are the same - some are designed for steep terrain with potentially deep snow while others aren't. These are the acceptable brands and models:

• Tubbs Flex ALP, Flex VRT, Flex TRK, or Mountaineers.

• MSR Lightening, Revo, or Evo. 

• TSL Symbioz Elite or Expert. 

• Atlas Aspect, Endeavor, or Series 10/11/12.

You will also need traction - while you can bring mountaineering crampons if you want I think all you will need is either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:


• </a><a href="http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf">http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the Ammonoosuc winter lot which is just below the Cog Railway Station on the right/south side of the access road. It is past the signed WMNF parking lot. According to Google Maps this spot is about 162 miles from Boston and it will take about 2 hours 48 minutes to drive there.

Use this link to customize the driving directions:

• https://goo.gl/maps/KWdbtWu3X7z 

</a>

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the <a href="http://www.hikesafe.com/">Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
Ipswich River offers more than 12 miles of trails that invite you to explore the forests, meadows, and wetlands. A drumlin and esker, key landscape features, were formed by a glacier 15,000 years ago. Boulders stacked to create arches and a grotto setting, constructed in 1905, provide an adventurous walk along the Rockery Trail.

The sanctuary fee is $4.00 for non-Audubon membersand free to members.

Duration: Approximately 2 to 3 hours, but please remember that this is an estimate and can vary greatly according to the group, weather and trail conditions.

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. I am committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up. 

Please note this is not a beginners’ hike. It is for intermediate level hikers and beginning hikers who keep in fit condition doing other things. You should be in good enough physical condition to keep up and stay with the group going at a moderate pace. Please do not show up for an event unexpected or unprepared.Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain or extreme temperature cancels.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. 

Please remember that I am a volunteer, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

 By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below:
Remember: I am a volunteer. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.

Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary 87 Perkins Row, Topsfield, MA 01983 (978)[masked]

...For more info go to http://www.massaudubon.org/get-outdoors/wildlife-sanctuaries/ipswich-river/about

results.description:
The Talk:Learn the exact marketing system of leading Silicon Valley apps to supercharge your mobile growth  

Presented by: Nagi Salloum, mobile growth expert in Silicon Valley 

Host: Jeff Robinson

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENTCLICK HERE

About the webinar:

Without a well engineered mobile-centric marketing system in place, like 90% of startups, you will most likely struggle to build consistent traction to grow your app before you run out of money (and consequently kill your startup).

In this webinar, you'll learn the exact marketing system of leading Silicon Valley apps, and real-world examples that will help you grow your app even if you don't have a marketing team or a marketing budget.

Some of what you'll learn

• The 6 signs your marketing is killing your startup (without you knowing) and how to fix them.

• The critical 4 stages of marketing you need to master.

• A simple free hack to 40x your installs.

• How to hack Whatsapp to earn free installs

• How to hack the app stores to 5x your organic installs and a lot more.... 

About Nagi: 

Nagihas 12 years of marketing expertise and currently the founder of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step by step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the Chief Marketing Officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for P&G . 

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many more..

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT CLICK HERE 

Date: Monday, February 15th

Duration: 60 mins with Q&A

Time: 9am - 10am San Francisco time

• How to hack the app stores to 5x your organic installs and a lot more.... 

About Nagi: 

Nagihas 12 years of marketing expertise and currently the founder of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step by step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the Chief Marketing Officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for P&G . 

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many more..

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT CLICK HERE 

Date: Monday, February 15th

Duration: 60 mins with Q&A

Time: 9am - 10am San Francisco time 

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENTCLICK HERE
results.name: Learn How Silicon Valley's Leading Mobile Apps Get So Powerful and Supercharged

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Monday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

As I do every year, I am going to be running a meetup to attend the Bugs Bunny Festival at the Brattle.  We will be going on Monday February 15th....Presidents Day.

Showtime is 6PM.  I will get there by 5:30 and we will head in for seats as soon as they let us...probably around 5:45.  


The Brattle Theater is in Harvard Square, so the best way to get there is by T.   It is a holiday, so residential parking is not enforced.   But I strongly advise using the train or bus.  It is much easier.

After the show we will head out to a nearby restaurant for drinks and munchies.  We will meet in the front of the theater after the movie.  So hang for a few minutes till everyone gets outside.

Mon, Feb 15, 2016

21st Annual Bugs Bunny Film Festival

Daffy Duck & Friends at 6:00• 

BUY TICKETS

A school vacation treat for kids and fun-loving adults alike, the Brattle’s BUGS BUNNY FILM FESTIVAL has been delighting audiences for over twenty years! DAFFY DUCK AND FRIENDS features Bugs’ frequently frustrated second-fiddle, Daffy Duck, alongside the rest of the Looney Tunes.

results.description:
Aurum Restaurant & Boston Ferments are teaming up again for a night of fermentation on Monday, February 15th! Our last workshop was standing room only so we’ve decided to do it again. The night will include a fermented dinner & paired fermented cocktails, a short lecture on the history & culture of fermentation, and a hands-on fermentation demo. The evening kicks off with a fermentation-inspired vegetarian kimchi Syrian pie (with gluten free & vegan options) + a selection of sides. We are pairing this meal with a number of locally made fermented drinks served in handmade ceramic cups (which you will take home!) by workshop leader Jeremy Ogusky.

Next, we will have a short lecture on the biological, political, and symbolic 'culture' of fermented foods around the world and we will then learn to make one of the simplest lacto-fermented treats - sauerkraut! All participants will finish the workshop with a healthy belly full of fermented foods, the knowledge & confidence to begin fermenting in their kitchen, and a jar full of fermenting kraut. This starter class will cover everything you need to start fermenting on your own: philosopy, preparation and problem-solving. Please join us!

Get your tickets at fermentinjp.eventbrite.com
results.name: fermentation themed dinner & cocktails + fermentation 101 workshop

results.description:
Please come and join us for a pleasant evening of competitive party bridge in Panera Bread, located in the Fresh Pond mall, about a 10 minute walk from Alewife station. The more the merrier, so long as you know how to play.

This meetup is officially canceled unless at least five sign up by 5pm. We can still play with four if we re-confirm. Check this space at 5pm if quorum questions exist. Out of courtesy, please do not sign up casually, nor cancel out on the day of event except in emergencies.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play this week. No formal training is to be offered, but this is a social, casual event. To assist novices, bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed on any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above in yellow, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.
results.how_to_find_us: Check out the big oval table up front.  Else look about, especially towards the back.
results.name: A Bridge Party near Fresh Pond

results.description:
New:

Due to time constraints and the game being very adjustable to new players joining and leaving at any time, I am making a change.

I do wish people to get something to compensate IHOP for letting us use the space, however, if you have not started or finished eating by 7:15pm please, start or finish eating at another table. The rest of the people will clean the table and start playing.  I want the rest of the players to have a chance to finish a game.


The rules give new players the opportunity to join the game at the start of any new hand, with the score of the mean player.

I am trying to keep the game and conversation balanced for everyone.  If multiple players are eating, conversing and playing,  the game may be held up until some people are restless.

Also, the more people eating and playing while handling the cards, the greater chance the few decks of "Jumbo Index" cards used for Negation Hearts will be marked and hard to shuffle, detracting from the game.

As always, please put your cold drinks on a napkin.

Thank you;

Negation Hearts Night. New players are VERY welcome: We will teach you how to play.

It is suggested that you get a drink or something else there, to compensate the hosting establishment. .

PUBLIC:

Both: The 450 and 456 Buses have nearby stops. 

Negation Hearts is played with two decks of cards. Two of the same cards like two king of clubs negate and the next highest card of the suit lead takes the cards played. So, even playing a two has not been safe at times. The scoring and passing are slightly altered from "Cancellation" hearts so that new people can join in or leave at the start of any hand.

The 50 cent charge is totally voluntary and is only to approximately cover the meetup charge.

This is SOCIAL CARDS conversation is encouraged, however please be aware of when it is your turn to play a card, we try to keep the fun balanced between the two.
results.name: Negation Hearts in Salem @ IHOP *

results.description:
Long-established concepts of multi-stakeholder, hybrid, or solidarity cooperatives are getting new urgency and vitality from the Platform Cooperativism movement which calls for an Internet of Ownership.  It is a vision for online platforms that share democratic ownership and governance with their stakeholders, especially those who contribute their labor and personal data.  If millions of people rely on a social network for communication than the relatively small number of people building the platform.

How does Platform Cooperativism affect you and your coop or your plans to build a coop? What other movements does it intersect with?

Please come with your thoughts and questions for a roundtable discussion.  Some members of Agaric can share what we've learned from coordinators and players in this new space, but the space is new in a lot of ways and you should be part of defining it! Learn about some local efforts in this movement too!

Potluck dishes are welcome— Agaric will also provide some snacks and non-alcoholic beverages, so come as you are.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the event space on the second floor. Signage will be posted.
results.name: Platform Cooperatives & You: When does freedom call for more than worker-owned?

Austin Walker will be speaking about managing your financial data with ledger and Emacs:

Ledger is a command line accounting tool for Linux, Mac, and Windows. Transactions are stored in a simple text format, so your data is available wherever you can use a text editor. My editor of choice is Emacs using ledger-mode, which offers autocompletion for account names and other useful functions. I currently manage about 5 years of my own financial data with Ledger, and I plan to continue for many years to come!

results.description:
Q & A:


Q.  I have never played x-wing, can I still play? 


A.  Yes, we will teach and supply ships and materials.  

Q.  Should I bring something? 
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served, feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/beverages in the pizza cup.


Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm? 
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game instead of X-Wing, can we do that? 
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want.  The game room will accomodate more players doing other games.  Just make sure you have game partners for that game or that you are fine in joining the x-wing game if no other players show up for the other game.

You can pay online in advance when you RSVP, and save time for drawing during the session.  Please customize the amount you're paying online according to whether you've paid your membership this month or not ($10 for members, $25 for a one-time drop in- which can be converted to a membership should you come back that same month). You may also pay your $25 monthly membership when that comes due each month online either together with the payment for the drawing session or separately through the link to the left on the sidebar.

Parking is on-street legally for two hours for people without Somerville parking permits, BUT WE PREFER THAT YOU PARK IN THE LOT AROUND BACK, WHICH IS OPEN till about 11PM.  The building is a working factory, so the lot is monitored and safe, though it is a bit of a walk around the building to the front door.   Please do not leave your car in the lot past 11pm or so, or on Saturdays past three pm, as they lock the gate if there is not late shift and your car will be locked in until the next shift starts at the factory.

results.description:
Let's discuss the criminal justice and prison systems. What are the problems? What is the goal for prison, reform or punishment?

Mandatory minimum sentences have resulted in unfair sentencing. However, prior to minimum sentencing, some wacky judges were able to give almost no time for a defendant guilty of a heinous crime, denying victims proper justice. What's the answer?

http://www.ozy.com/pov/the-one-issue-where-republicans-and-obama-agree/66523?utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=US

There's also the issue of private prisons where inmates are used as slave labor. There have been issues with judges taking kickbacks.

http://www.democracynow.org/2014/2/4/kids_for_cash_inside_one_of

http://www.forbes.com/sites/walterpavlo/2011/08/12/pennsylvania-judge-gets-life-sentence-for-prison-kickback-scheme/

Some other links:
http://www.pbs.org/now/society/prisons.html

http://www.pbs.org/pov/whatiwant/links-books/
results.name: America's criminal justice and Prison System

results.description:
(Please note our new RSVP policy below.) 


We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.  Games often last 90 minutes or more and involve juggling a lot of rules and factors in your head, to decide what to do.  However, there's also plenty of laughter and friendship involved.  If that sounds up your alley, we hope you'll join us.

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message earlier in the day, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm onwards.  Our group has been running since 2007, and we have a large crowd of regulars as well as new members each week.

1. Due to finite space, you must RSVP to attend.


2. Please be considerate of others -- only RSVP if you are likely to attend.  Likewise, if you need to cancel your RSVP, please do so at least 24 hours before the event.  This allows enough notice for someone else to use your spot.

3. Please save loud and/or big games (like those with real-time arguing) for after 9:30, when the room is less full.  This allows us to accommodate more people, and play a greater variety of games.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle


As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan, Carcassonne, and Ticket to Ride.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right. There is a suggested donation of $1.00 that goes towards site fees and party supplies.  (When we have a raffle, you will also receive an extra raffle ticket as thanks for donating.)

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.



OTHER POLICY DETAILS:

If you would like to come but there are no spots, consider attending our alternative "Light Game Night" a few steps away at Cosi Cafe.  You can also sign up as "wants a spot" and receive emails from meetup if a spot opens up.

We know everyone has emergencies.  But consistent, inconsiderate use of RSVPs -- which includes being a "no show", cancelling in the last 24 hours, or constantly cancelling RSVPs -- will lead to being removed from the group.  Sorry, we still like you, it's just not fair to everyone else!

If you use a "+1" spot, you are responsible for all of the above for your +1.  Since you are using two spots, it is extra important that you are considerate about it.

NEW MEMBERS: Welcome!  We look forward to meeting you.  If you want to bring a friend, please have them sign up with their own account rather than using a +1.  Unfortunately, we've gotten a lot of no-show +1's from first time attendees, so we don't accept those anymore.  Sorry!
results.how_to_find_us: Walk a quarter of a block away from the Kendall T, in the opposite direction from the Marriott Plaza.  We're in the big building on your right (across from the parking lot).  When you enter, our room is just across the foyer and on your right.
results.name: Monday Game Night

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) at 7 PM.  We usually wait 5-10 minutes for people to show, but if you arrive later and miss us at the table,  check the small whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what the Event Host (see RSVP list) is wearing that day, and come find us on the walls.  Don't be shy, make an effort to ask around and find the group; we're all friendly.

(NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive by 7, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from cubbies, if available).
results.name: MetroRock Monday

results.description:
On Monday 2/15 PJ Ryan's is hosting a huge release party for Ommegang's Barrel-Aged Three Philosophers. In addition to this epic beer, they will have some other super rare brews, prizes and more! RSVP here! 

Be one of the few to try the Bourbon Barrel Three Philosophers. This is the ONLY Massachusetts release of this beer. Three Philosophers is one of Ommegang's HIGHEST rated beers and has only been barrel aged one other time in the brewery's history. Seriously. Get this before it runs out. 

 
Want some Rye? Course ya do! Boulevard's Rye on Rye on Rye is a double rye ale that's barrel aged in Templeton and Sazerac Rye Whiskey Barrels. This spicy brew is another hard to find specialty. 

Ommegang is also bringing a Super Secret Pilot Saison batch. This is a beer you definitely won't find anywhere else. Give it a shot and let Matt from Ommegang know what you think of the beer! 

With a bunch of other delicious brews, some great free prizes and a chance to try some super rare beers, this will be a night to remember. Don't forget to RSVP!

Full Beer List: -Bourbon Barrel Three Philosophers

-Soothsayer Belgian Strong Ale

-Chocolate Ale w/Raspberry

-Test Saison

-Houblon Chouffe

- Rye on Rye on Rye
results.name: Ommegang Release Party! Barrel-Aged Three Philosophers; Barrel-Aged Rye Ale!

results.description:
This is our brand new auxiliary meetup event.  This is a great opportunity to socialize and play games in a relaxed environment -- and best of all, there's no cap on attendance.

We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, but the games at this particular event are going to be on the smaller side -- because those are often the games that work best in a cafe setting.

Our main meetup requires RSVPs due to heavy popularity and finite space.  This event runs simultaneously, two buildings away.  RSVPs are NOT required for this event.  RSVPs are still appreciated so the event hosts know how many people to expect, but you don't need to update them and can come even if you don't RSVP.

This event takes place once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 - 9:30 or 10.  Cosi closes at 10, but after 9:30, you are welcome to come and join the regular meetup at that point, no RSVP required.

Cosi Cafe has graciously allowed us to use their back seating area every week.  You are not required to buy anything from them, but their food is honestly pretty good, so please take advantage of them if you are hungry for dinner, soft drinks, or snacks.

We play whatever people bring, but you don't have to bring anything -- the hosts will always have a bag of games with them!  Some games that you might expect to see here include:

Red 7, Love Letter, Codenames, Pictomania, The Resistance, Avalon, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, Bang!, Glory to Rome, Innovation, Mottainai, Chrononaughts, Time Lines, Tash-Kalar

If you're looking for longer or larger Euros (like 7 Wonders, Puerto Rico, or Terra Mystica), check out our regular "Game Night" meetup.

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs up, then up again towards the busy street, which is Main Street.  Turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it. 
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south. 
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

7-7:15 PM


Receive a Chinese Red Pocket and learn how to write “Good Luck” and "Spring"  in Chinese characters, with which you can decorate your door


7:15- 7:30 PM


See a Kung Fu demonstration by Joe Gallop. Joe did many  Kung Fu demonstrations at many events such as First night Boston, or Boston Green Fest. He also taught Kung Fu and Tai Chi class in MIT and UMass Boston. Learn some Kung Fu moves from Joe after his demostration.

7:30-8:30 PM

Follow along as Shifu Huan performs the first thirteen movements of Yang Style Tai Chi. Huan is a 6th-generation practitioner, having studied under three Grandmasters from the Yang family. He is the author of the book Seeing Beyond the Tai Chi Footprint and Co-Author of a University Text Book O& M for Independent Living and his articles have been featured in the international Tai Chi Magazine.

Huan then will start the warm-up and then give detailed instructions of the Yang-style tai chi form.

Fee $10 ( to help us pay rent and other related costs)

Question:

This sounds like a great deal, but is it meant for those in need, as is the case with food banks? 

Answer:

• For this operation, there are "No qualifications - no limits!" 

Thanks to the efficiency and BI (business intelligence) of Fair Foods of Dorchester (FairFoods.org), founded about 35 years ago by self-reported vegetarian Nancy Jamison, we have way more than AMPLE food for any intended audiences, and the operation is bettered if MORE people take the food than if FEWER take the food. 

Therefore, there is NO QUALIFICATION (no test of need) and no limit to how much you can cart off (just pay $2/bag). 

That's why it's posted on a meetup like this (not merely on a volunteer meetup). 

* There are tens of thousands of college students who could benefit by saving some money on their weekly produce purchases. 
* There are tens of thousands (myriads) of homemakers and working individuals who could benefit by saving some money on their weekly produce purchases. 
* Lots and lots of seniors AND needy folks, and there's no operational shame in prudent fiscal management if you know that you can get quality produce at a far lower price. 

[The snag is that, unlike in grocery stores - or even in Haymarket, your variety of produce is severely limited here because you're getting what Fair Foods sends to any specific site; you are unable to select from a broader arrangement of vegetables and a broader arrangement of fruits.  Typically, you get about 7-11 different items - about 5-8 different vegetables and 2-3 fruits, and you're often 'gifted' with extra items - 30 ounce jug of fresh hummus or lentil salad or chickpea salads, pound of garlic, large one-lb plastic container of ground pepper, or lots of other 'big items' we don't typically buy.] 

Make us busy - very busy.

The arrival of Edward Logue as the head of the Boston Redevelopment Authority ushered in a new generation of buildings in Boston. Greetings South Shore Web Developers. Some of you may know me, some may not. My name is Matt Ulvila and i'm co-founder of 3thought. We're a small design/development shop in Plymouth MA. We've been looking to have a night where south shore web workers can gather, have a few drinks. A no pressure evening out with like minded people. No pitches, no talks, just conversation over some adult beverages and the start of some new friendships.

Here's the details.

Meetup Date: The 3rd Tuesday of the Month

Location: BBC in Pembroke MA

Time: 6-8pm

The manager has a spot for us in the back of the restaurant. Depending on group size and where everyone is coming from, we can look into modifying times/places etc., but for now this how it will work.

And... I would love if you could please help me spread the word about the group. It's free for you to tweet or post a link to linkedin/facebook, and would really mean a lot if you could help.

Looking forward to meeting you all next week.

cheers

-matt

results.description:
The advent of the web and digital marketing tactics have made marketing and communication much more complicated for startups and large organizations. How your prospects find information and make buying decisions varies widely by title, profession, industry, and age. To help you navigate all the digital marketing options is a panel of experts across media from email to social media, PR, to content marketing, SEO, and web sites


Once you have objectives and audience demographics figured out, our panelists will provide advice on tactics to meet your expectations.

Panel:

Bob Cargill, Director, Social Media, Overdrive Interactive

Bob Cargill was named "Direct Marketer of the Year" for 2009 by the New England Direct Marketing Association (NEDMA), is director of social media at Overdrive Interactive (http://www.ovrdrv.com/). During the course of his career, his work has been recognized with more than 40 awards, including Gold for his blog, Gold for Best Tweets and Silver for Best Copywriting from NEDMA. Bob likes to keep his fingers on the pulse of the industry in which he earns his livelihood. Not only has he presented many times about social media, copywriting and direct marketing, he has been published or quoted on his areas of expertise in numerous media outlets. In fact, he is currently a regular columnist for ClickZ.com on the subject of social media. He is a Past President of NEDMA and a graduate of Leadership MetroWest's Leadership Academy. You can follow him on Twitter at @cargillcreative.

Dave Sears, Founder & CEO, Print Resource

Dave Sears is a seasoned business executive with in-depth startup expertise, having founded 15 small companies over the past 25 years, and advising many others. Dave's roles have included VP of Operations at an international magazine and software publisher, Chief Strategic Officer and operations executive at a national real estate consumer advisory, and CEO of an Inc. 500 award-winning printing firm, Print Resource. He currently serves on the board of advisors of a pre-launch startup in the baby products space, and consults as a key solutions strategist, operations expert, and catalyst for growth at an award-winning, international, government contracting firm.


Christina J. Inge, Founder of ThoughtLight, CEO of Sleek Marketing University, <a>www.sleekmarketingu.com.</a> Twitter: @christinainge, LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/in/christinainge

Christina is a marketing consultant with over 20 years experience in content creation, web technologies, and project management. Her areas of expertise include the design of social media marketing campaigns that boost brand recognition and affiliation. Through best practices SEO, she teaches methods that enhance click-through experiences, improve conversion rates and increase organic search rankings. She helps companies with product go-to-market plans, email marketing strategy and implementation, online lead conversion and lead generation analysis and optimization, and product positioning. Through Sleek Marketing University she teaches the latest digital marketing techniques to help startups, businesses, and nonprofits reach new audiences cost-effectively. Subjects addressed include SEO, Google Analytics, social media, marketing automation and many others.

Isabelle Kane, Vice president, SimplyDIRECT, SD 2.0


Isabelle Kane is a widely-recognized expert in inbound and content marketing. She has achieved wide success in marketing leadership roles and is an innovative media strategist who brings deep expertise to SimplyDIRECT. With more than 25 years of marketing experience, Kane comes to the SD team most recently from DWA, where she established the agency’s Boston office while serving as Senior Vice President of Client Services. While at DWA, Isabelle developed a new approach to the emerging field of Intent Marketing, which can be described as the science of harnessing critical data signals to identify, nurture and capture in-market buyers. 

Prior to her success at DWA, Kane held numerous other positions in roles of increasing responsibility, at marketing agencies that include PJA and Pro Media, Inc. She independently ran her own marketing strategy consultancy for more than eight years, as well. Kane is an authority on the unique marketing challenges of B2B2C companies and their complex sales cycles and channels, with particular fluency in the High Tech, Consumer Tech, and Life Sciences industries.

Isabelle Kane, Vice president, SimplyDIRECT, SD 2.0

Isabelle Kane is a widely-recognized expert in inbound and content marketing. She has achieved wide success in marketing leadership roles and is an innovative media strategist who brings deep expertise to SimplyDIRECT. With more than 25 years of marketing experience, Kane comes to the SD team most recently from DWA, where she established the agency’s Boston office while serving as Senior Vice President of Client Services. While at DWA, Isabelle developed a new approach to the emerging field of Intent Marketing, which can be described as the science of harnessing critical data signals to identify, nurture and capture in-market buyers. 

Prior to her success at DWA, Kane held numerous other positions in roles of increasing responsibility, at marketing agencies that include PJA and Pro Media, Inc. She independently ran her own marketing strategy consultancy for more than eight years, as well. Kane is an authority on the unique marketing challenges of B2B2C companies and their complex sales cycles and channels, with particular fluency in the High Tech, Consumer Tech, and Life Sciences industries.

Moderator:

Howard Sholkin, Principal, Sholkin Consulting

Howard Sholkin has more than 40 years of journalism and marketing communication experience. In 2014, he formed Sholkin Consulting to deliver strategy and tactical marketing services to influence an organization’s prospects, grow its business, and elevate a firm’s brand and its products and services. He joined International Data Group (IDG)—the world’s leading technology media, event, and research company--as director of corporate communications in 2003 providing PR support for Founder and Chairman Pat McGovern and subsidiaries. Sholkin was later promoted to a director’s position for communication and marketing programs for the CEO of IDG Communications, the media and events subsidiary, and for the CEO of IDG Global Solutions.

Prior to IDG, Sholkin held senior marketing and communication positions at technology companies, which included Computervision, Technology Concepts (a subsidiary of Bell Atlantic), Digital Equuipment Corp./Compaq, and Getronics (successor to Wang). He is also an instructor at Lasell College in Newton. Before entering the tech industry in 1981, he was a news producer at WCVB-TV in Boston. Since 1990, Sholkin has been active in the Public Relations Society of America (PRSA) where he became president of the Boston chapter. by Roland Guijt

results.description:
Do you want to come across as a professional who speaks in a clear, articulate and confident manner while speaking on-the-spot? Join us to practice the art of impromptu speaking.

Takeaways:

• Tips & advice on how to speak off-the-cuff

• Public speaking secrets to help you own the floor

• Impromptu speaking exercises and feedback sessions

What is Impromptu Speaking?

Impromptu speaking or speaking off-the-cuff is speaking without any planning or preparation. These situations occur every day in your personal or professional life. In one-on-one conversations you might engage in a debate with a friend or your boss might ask for your input on a project. A co-worker calls in sick and ask if you can speak on her behalf during the group meeting. You might even have to give an impromptu speech at a special occasion or be called upon on to give an unexpected toast.

“Communication is a skill that you can learn. It’s like riding a bicycle or typing. If you’re willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of every part of your life.” - Brian Tracy

SPEAKER: Kit is a TEDx Speaker Coach and the founder of the SuperHero Institute and BostonSpeaks. www.kitpang.com

About BostonSpeaks:

BostonSpeaks is dedicated to enhancing your communication skills to drastically improve your relationships, self-awareness and professional success. www.bostonspeaks.com
results.name: Impromptu Speaking! Yikes!

Join Jennifer Glanville and Megan Parisi, two kick ass ladies in beer, as they talk about Sam Adams new product development (beer) and Sam Adams new Nano brewery. We will also get to sample some of their delicious beers paired with cheese.

Tickets are $10 and can be purchased at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/babes-talk-and-tasting-at-sam-adams-tickets-21164037205

Proceeds from tickets sales will go to Samuel Adams Brewing the American Dream Program.

Here's more information about Brewing the American Dream

Samuel Adams is celebrating 31 years of brewing, and despite the craft brewery’s success, Jim Koch hasn’t forgotten how hard it is to start and run a successful small business. That’s why he created Samuel Adams Brewing the American Dream, a unique program that provides the two things he wishes he had when starting Samuel Adams: financing and real-world business advice.

As the core philanthropic program for Samuel Adams, Brewing the American Dream is executed in partnership with Accion—the largest nonprofit micro- and small business lender in the United States. Since Brewing the American Dream began in 2008, Samuel Adams and Accion have provided nearly $8.5 million in microloans to 825 entrepreneurs nationwide, coached more than 6,000 small business owners, and helped create or retain more than 3,300 jobs. The program has also seen an unprecedented loan repayment rate of 98.1 percent – well above the national average for small business loans.
results.name: Talk and Tasting with Sam Adams
